Experts suggest the government may even surpass this goal, sending a positive message to international investors about fiscal discipline. Despite a revised nominal GDP growth forecast, absolute figures align with budget estimates. This achievement is expected to bolster confidence in India's economic management.

articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: The Indian Micro-Fertilizers Manufacturers Association has requested the central government to implement key changes. articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings

Negligence or inaction, including by government bodies, cannot justify condonation. The post Courts cannot condone delay based on partial or selective explanations: SC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Cash Sale Deeds Before 2017: When Penalty Does Not Apply?
articles.summary: Judicial relief under Section 269SS was limited to advances and loans. After April 1, 2017, Section 269ST overrides this position by banning cash receipts above ₹2 lakh outright. The post Cash Sale Deeds Before 2017: When Penalty Does Not Apply? appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Disallowance u/s. 14A restricted to extent of exempted income earned during relevant year
articles.summary: Delhi High Court held that the disallowance under Section 14A of the Income Tax Act is to be restricted to the exempted income. Amendment to section 14A in terms of Finance Act, 2022 is prospective in nature. Accordingly, appeal of revenue dismissed. The post Disallowance u/s. 14A restricted to extent of exempted income earned during relevant year appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Only Unexplained Portion of Cash Deposits Can Be Taxed: ITAT Chennai
articles.summary: Cash deposits arising from routine business collections cannot be wholly treated as unexplained income. The ruling confirms that estimations must reflect the nature of the taxpayer’s business. The post Only Unexplained Portion of Cash Deposits Can Be Taxed: ITAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: Nvidia and US pharma giant ‍Eli Lilly will spend $1 ​billion building a new joint research lab in ⁠the San Francisco Bay area over five years which will use Nvidia's newest generation Vera Rubin AI chips, the firms said on Monday.

articles.title: Ola Electric enters residential energy storage with Shakti rollout, diversifies beyond EVs
articles.summary: Shakti, announced earlier by founder Bhavish Aggarwal, is powered by Ola Electric’s indigenously developed 4680 Bharat Cell and is positioned as a residential and small commercial energy storage solution.

articles.title: Meta appoints former Trump adviser Dina Powell as president and vice chair
articles.summary: Dina Powell McCormick, who has worked with both US President Donald Trump and former President George W Bush, is expected to join Meta’s management team, where she will work closely with its compute and infrastructure teams to oversee large-scale, multi-billion-dollar investments in data centres, energy systems, and global connectivity.

articles.title: Shadowfax to launch IPO next week at Rs 7,400-crore valuation: Sources
articles.summary: Shadowfax, a Flipkart-backed logistics firm, is set to launch its IPO next week at a lower-than-expected valuation of around Rs 7,400 crore. The company aims to raise Rs 1,900 crore, partly to expand its network and partly for brand-building. Shadowfax has posted strong revenue and profit growth in recent years.

articles.title: Govt refutes Reuters report on demanding source code from Apple, Samsung
articles.summary: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has said that a Reuters report which claims the union government has demanded that smartphone makers share their source code is false. The report also stated that firms like Apple and Samsung have to implement software changes due to the government’s security concerns.

articles.title: HCL Technologies Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 11% YoY to Rs 4,076 crore, revenue rises 13%; Rs 12 per share dividend declared
articles.summary: HCL Tech Q3 Results: HCL Technologies on Monday reported an 11% YoY fall in its December quarter consolidated net profit at Rs 4,076 crore compared to Rs 4,591 crore reported in the year ago period. The profit after tax (PAT) is attributable to the owners of the company.

articles.title: Infra.Market FY25 revenue jumps 27% to Rs 18,472 crore, profit falls 42%
articles.summary: Infra.Market reported strong topline growth in FY25, with revenue rising sharply year-on-year, even as profitability weakened. Higher costs across materials, staffing and finance dragged net profit down significantly. The Mumbai-based construction materials platform has filed confidentially for a Rs 5,000-crore IPO and was last valued at about $2.8 billion.

articles.title: TCS Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 14% YoY to Rs 10,657 crore, but revenue rises 5%
articles.summary: TCS Q3 Results: Revenue from operations in Q3FY26 rose 5% year-on-year to Rs 67,087 crore, up from Rs 63,973 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.

articles.title: India to be invited to join US-led AI initiative
articles.summary: India will be invited next month to join a new US-led initiative aimed at securing AI supply chains, the new US ambassador to New Delhi said Monday. Dubbed the "Pax Silica", after the Latin terms for peace and silicon, the alliance aims to secure supply chains of key components independent of China.

articles.title: Demand for AI, tech experts pushes UK financial sector vacancies up 12%, recruiter says
articles.summary: The year-on-year increase happened despite a slowdown in the fourth quarter, as volatility in global markets and uncertainty about the government's November ​budget prompted caution in hiring ​managers, Morgan McKinley's London Employment Monitor, ‌a ‍quarterly survey of financial services vacancies, ‍showed.

articles.title: Account suspended: X shelves iconic @twitter handle
articles.summary: Users who attempt to access the @Twitter handle are now greeted with the message "Account Suspended", noting that the account violated X's rules. Screenshots popped up late Friday, with memes and jokes about the platform policing its own past.

articles.title: What the Grok controversy reveals about NSFW content from AI chatbots
articles.summary: Grok is facing serious scrutiny after previously enabling users to generate sexually explicit visual content involving real individuals, raising concerns around personal safety, dignity, privacy, and consent. While Elon Musk-owned xAI has since rolled back access, restricting image and video generation to its paid subscribers, the incident has sparked a larger question about AI chatbots generating sexually explicit content.

articles.title: Zepto claims Hyderabad accident victim was not its delivery partner
articles.summary: The incident occurred in the city's Mehdipatnam police limits, where a rider named Abhishek, a native of Shekpet, died after his two-wheeler collided with a bus. Police officials said that the victim worked as a delivery rider for Zepto, prompting the Gig Workers’ Union to demand justice and compensation for the family.

articles.title: Meta urges Australia to change teen social media ban
articles.summary: Tech giant Meta urged Australia on Monday to rethink its world-first social media ban for under-16s, while reporting that it has blocked more than 544,000 accounts under the new law. Australia has required big platforms including Meta, TikTok and YouTube to stop underage users from holding accounts since the legislation came into force on December 10 last year.

articles.title: Google's Gemini seeks edge in AI for online shopping
articles.summary: Google on Sunday unveiled a new iteration of its professional Gemini AI suite geared toward online retail, seeking to create seamless interactions for shoppers from product searches to customer service. Walmart said the tool would help it offer products best suited to its customers' needs, more regularly converting product searches into sales.

articles.title: Mixed Q3 awaits Indian ER&D companies navigating auto sector headwinds
articles.summary: Indian engineering service firms like Tata Elxsi, KPIT and LTTS are set for a mixed Q3 due to weak auto demand, though rising R D in EVs and hybrids offers support. Analysts expect modest 1–2.8% revenue growth, with EU-focused companies benefiting more than US-exposed peers. These firms' FY26 growth could reach 15–20%.

articles.title: IT hardware distributor Mitsumi Distribution eyes Rs 1,000 crore India play
articles.summary: Mitsumi Distribution is entering India with a Rs 700–1,000 crore investment over three years to build infrastructure, inventory and logistics. The company will target underpenetrated tier-II to tier-IV cities, avoiding saturated metro markets. Operations have begun in Mumbai, Delhi and Bengaluru, with plans to expand rapidly across smaller cities.

articles.title: Anti-money laundering norms up crypto compliance bar
articles.summary: India’s financial intelligence unit has tightened anti-money laundering rules for crypto firms, increasing compliance and security obligations. Mandatory registration, audits and stricter KYC norms may raise costs and slow new entrants. While this could reduce misuse and improve trust, smaller platforms may struggle under heavier regulatory pressure.

articles.title: IT ministry takes up communications device safety issue; mobile phone players say routine consultation
articles.summary: The IT ministry has taken over discussions on mobile phone and communication device safety from the telecom department under the ITSAR framework. Industry sources say this is a routine consultation with no new mandates. Talks focus on standards for software updates and device source code, ensuring transparent engagement with manufacturers.

articles.title: India tightens crypto noose: Live selfies, geo-tagging now mandatory for users
articles.summary: India has tightened rules for cryptocurrency exchanges, introducing tougher AML and KYC checks. Users must complete live selfie verification, location tracking and enhanced identity checks, while risky tokens and ICOs are discouraged. Exchanges must monitor high-risk clients closely and keep detailed records to combat money laundering and terrorism financing risks.

articles.title: India proposes forcing smartphone makers to give source code in security overhaul: Report
articles.summary: India is reportedly proposing new security rules for smartphones. These rules include sharing source code and making software changes. Tech companies like Apple and Samsung are opposing these measures. They argue the requirements lack global precedent and risk revealing proprietary information.

articles.title: Meta denies data breach of 17.5 million users; asks users to ignore password reset emails
articles.summary: In 2021, Facebook, another Meta company, reported that data of over 350 million users had been exposed from publicly accessible profiles but not breached. Data breaches at other major social media platforms, X and LinkedIn, were reported in 2018 and 2021, impacting billions of users.

articles.title: Under EU scrutiny, Musk vows to release X’s algorithm code every four weeks
articles.summary: This is not the first time X has promised to make its algorithms open source. Elon Musk had made similar commitments in 2022 and 2023. However, the latest publicly available update to its recommendation code dates back to March 2023.

articles.title: ITAT rejects Binny Bansal's 'non-resident' status claim
articles.summary: The Bengaluru bench of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) has rejected Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal's claim of non-resident status for assessment year 2020-21, thereby denying him the benefit of the India-Singapore Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA).

articles.title: The man who could be Apple's next CEO
articles.summary: Around 2018, Apple weighed adding costly laser tech to iPhones, highlighting the cautious leadership style of hardware chief John Ternus. Now seen as a leading successor to CEO Tim Cook, Ternus embodies Apple’s incremental, profit-focused approach amid succession planning and innovation challenges.

articles.title: Cloudflare threatens Olympic services over piracy fine
articles.summary: US internet company Cloudflare has threatened to pull its services in Italy, including for the Winter Olympics, after being fined 14 million euros ($16 million) for failing to tackle online piracy.

articles.title: Uber Eats driver criticises Tesla Model Y; promotes 1999 Fiat in viral exchange
articles.summary: The driver reportedly told the customer that the two-decade-old Fiat was “built to last” and cheaper to maintain. The post drew mixed reactions, with some users backing the claim and joking that older European models often outlast modern cars because of their mechanical simplicity, while others defended Tesla’s Model Y for its energy efficiency and advanced technology. The debate comes as Tesla has lost its position as the world’s largest EV maker, after sales fell for a second straight year, an

articles.title: Google founders Larry Page, Sergey Brin pull back from California over wealth tax fears
articles.summary: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reducing their California business presence, moving companies to Nevada and buying property elsewhere, amid concern over a proposed California wealth tax on billionaires. The measure has sparked debate, with tech leaders warning it could drive capital and innovation out of Silicon Valley.

articles.title: TN's iTNT Hub inks pact with XeedQ GmbH for quantum computing programmes
articles.summary: The programme will be anchored by the Tamil Nadu Technology Hub (iTNT), a public–private initiative supported by the TN government that is an emerging and deeptech innovation network that works closely with academic institutions, startups, and research communities across the state. XeedQ GmbH will provide the remote access, quantum hardware, technical expertise, and learning support as part of this engagement.

articles.title: FCC approves SpaceX plan to deploy an additional 7,500 Starlink satellites
articles.summary: The agency said the additional satellites will provide direct-to-cell connectivity outside the United States and supplemental U.S. coverage, which will allow for next-generation mobile services as well as internet speeds of up to 1 gigabit per second.

articles.title: Chinese AI unicorn MiniMax soars 109% in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Shares in Chinese AI startup MiniMax soared 109% as it went public in Hong Kong on Friday, raising US$619 million in a sign that strong investor demand is rewarding the country's rapidly developing sector. Friday's shares performance shows investors have a "strong appetite for China's tech sector and the AI story", Gary Ng, senior economist at Natixis Corporate and Investment Banking, told AFP. The whole AI sector is still at an early stage of development, which requires massive investment, he s

articles.title: Grok limits image generation to paid users; not enough, says govt
articles.summary: MeitY's concernThe issue will remain if X continues to allow the generation, hosting, uploading or sharing of obscene and illegal content that hurts the privacy and dignity of our citizens, especially women and children, in any manner

articles.title: Democratic senators demand Apple, Google take X and Grok off app stores over sexual images: Report
articles.summary: Three Democratic ⁠US senators are ‌calling ‌on Apple and ‌Alphabet's Google to remove X and Grok ​from ​their respective ‌app ‍stores ‍over the spread of ‌nonconsensual sexual images of women and ‍minors on ‍the ⁠platforms, ⁠NBC News reported Friday.

articles.title: View: India has 7.4% growth, but where are the taxes?
articles.summary: Budget: Should the govt play to the gallery of domestic equity investors by lunging for growth? Or should it choose fiscal restraint to keep a lid on rising borrowing costs — both for itself and the private sector? There are no easy answers.

articles.title: MAGA deal in making: US resumes trade talks with ‘real friend’ India
articles.summary: US Ambassador designate Sergio Gor announced that trade pact discussions with India will resume Tuesday, aiming to resolve differences beyond tariffs. He emphasised the strong personal relationship between Trump and Modi, highlighting the partnership's significance beyond trade, encompassing security, technology, and energy cooperation.

articles.title: US tariff pressures push British Columbia to boost India trade
articles.summary: Canadian province's premier David Eby, who is leading a trade mission to India from January 12-17, told ET in an interview that the province is trying to develop more opportunities with India to diversify trade, which has been hit by the US tariffs.

articles.title: Net direct tax mopup rises 8.8% till January 11
articles.summary: Despite a slower pace of tax refunds, the growth in collection was much below the budgeted 12.7% increase for the entire 2025-26. With less than three months left in this fiscal, experts are cautiously optimistic about meeting the budget target of ₹25.20 lakh crore.

articles.title: Retail inflation hits 3-month high of 1.3% in December
articles.summary: In December 2025, retail inflation climbed to 1.3%, rising from November's 0.7%, setting a new three-month peak. While this increase remains shy of the central bank's goal, the easing of food deflation contrasted with the uptick in prices for various goods.

articles.title: Centre earmarks Rs 5,925 crore for coal, lignite exploration from FY27
articles.summary: The investment will be channeled through the Central Sector Scheme (CSS) of coal and lignite exploration.

articles.title: Germany's Merz in India: Amid American squeeze, Europe steps in
articles.summary: India is strategically reorienting its partnerships towards the European Union as U.S. trade faces increasing tariffs. Germany's Chancellor's visit highlights this shift, with a potential EU free trade agreement and growing defense cooperation signaling a comprehensive, structural realignment in India's foreign economic policy.

articles.title: Wheat sowing up 2 pc to 334.17 lakh hectares till Jan 9 of current rabi season: Govt
articles.summary: Wheat sowing has increased by 2 percent to 334.17 lakh hectares as of January 9. This rise in acreage for the rabi season is attributed to better monsoon rains and higher minimum support prices. Other rabi crops like paddy, pulses, Shri Anna, coarse cereals, and oilseeds have also seen increased sowing areas. Overall rabi crop coverage has reached 644.

articles.title: Net direct tax collection grows 8.82% to Rs 18.38 lakh crore till January 11
articles.summary: India's net direct tax collections have seen a significant increase of 8.82%, reaching Rs 18.38 lakh crore between April 1 and January 11. This growth encompasses both corporate and non-corporate tax contributions. Notably, total refunds issued during this period saw a substantial decrease of 16.92% compared to the previous year.

articles.title: Rapid digitalisation of banks reshaping financial risks, requires supervisors to fundamentally rethink: RBI DG
articles.summary: Speaking at the Third Annual Global Conference of the College of Supervisors in Mumbai, RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan J said that traditional indicators such as capital adequacy and liquidity are no longer sufficient to assess the health of banks in a technology-driven environment.

articles.title: BMI forecasts 7% growth for India in FY27
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth. BMI forecasts 7.4 per cent expansion for the current fiscal year and 7 per cent for FY27. Favourable policies and recent reforms are expected to boost investment and consumption. This positive outlook is supported by strong GDP estimates and rising exports. The foundation for continued economic progress is firmly in place.

articles.title: India’s retail inflation quickens for second straight month to 1.33% in December
articles.summary: India's retail inflation rose to 1.33% in December 2025, driven by increased costs in personal care, vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, spices, and pulses. Despite this uptick, inflation remained below the RBI's 4% target for the eleventh consecutive month. Food prices saw a reduced decline, with vegetable deflation easing.

articles.title: Growing inequality is the top economic concern for youth worldwide: WEF survey
articles.summary: A new World Economic Forum survey reveals that global youth identify growing inequality as their top economic concern. Many are also eager to enter politics rather than just critique, with over a third considering running for office. Climate change remains a defining global worry, even amidst personal financial anxieties.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Trump tariffs or not, trade power should stay with India
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: A 1985 Plaza Accord saw global powers coordinate to devalue the dollar, impacting Japan severely. Today, similar economic conditions and Donald Trump's protectionist policies are reshaping global trade. India, historically less integrated, may find an unexpected advantage in this shift towards self-sufficiency, potentially mitigating direct trade shocks.

articles.title: 'Protectionism hurts us both': Merz pushes for deeper India-Germany security ties as trade tops $50 billion
articles.summary: During his landmark trip to India, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz engaged in productive discussions with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The trade relationship has soared, surpassing fifty billion dollars, as both leaders sealed pivotal agreements focused on technology, defense, and renewable energy sources. Together, they tackled pressing global challenges and emphasised the importance of fortifying their security collaboration.

articles.title: Trump, Modi are ‘real friends’, says US ambassador Gor as India-US gear up for January 13 trade talks
articles.summary: With the inauguration of US Ambassador Sergio Gor in New Delhi, a new chapter in India-US relations begins. His mission highlights the deep-rooted friendship shared by both nations. Ongoing trade dialogues promise fruitful outcomes, with the next round of negotiations set to occur shortly.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Sitharaman & Co will be counting every rupee on the road to Viksit Bharat 2047
articles.summary: Budget 2026 approaches with India's fiscal calculations under scrutiny as tax collections have slowed, impacting government finances. The Finance Minister faces the challenge of maintaining fiscal consolidation amidst these pressures. Balancing growth with discipline will be key. Non-tax revenues and spending discipline are crucial. Market borrowing tolerance is also a significant consideration.

articles.title: Acquisition financing by Indian banks to sanctions risk, 2026 set to be a learning year for India Inc
articles.summary: In 2026, Indian enterprises are bracing for a transformative regulatory landscape, emphasizing toughness and adherence. Financial institutions are now empowered to support acquisitions, while private equity blossoms with the rise of secondary funds. However, the looming threat of sanctions remains a critical concern.

articles.title: Europe fills diplomatic agenda for India this week
articles.summary: Europe takes center stage in Indian diplomacy this week. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Monday, seeking trade expansion before the EU free trade agreement. France's Emmanuel Bonne arrives Monday and Tuesday, preparing for President Macron's February trip. Poland's foreign minister Radosław Sikorski follows. Prime Minister Modi meets Merz in Ahmedabad to boost cooperation.

articles.title: Budget 2026: As economy holds firm, India Inc urges focus on growth, capex and private investment
articles.summary: Businesses in India are urging the government to prioritize economic growth in the upcoming budget. They are calling for more reforms and increased government spending on infrastructure. Incentives for private investment and privatization are also key demands. Support for exporters facing challenges from US tariffs is crucial. The budget is expected to outline the path for future economic expansion.

articles.title: Credit demand zooms as policy eases, outstanding bank credit crossed Rs 200 lakh cr for the first time on Dec 31, 2025
articles.summary: India's credit demand is surging. Lower taxes and supportive monetary policy are fueling investment. Outstanding bank credit has crossed a major milestone. This growth surpasses projections, indicating a strong economic rebound. Auto loans, small and mid-sized companies, and home loans are key drivers. Investment intentions are translating into spending, creating a positive environment.

articles.title: Budget 2026: CII seeks rolling, 3-year pipeline for privatisation
articles.summary: Budget FY26 expectations: The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests a three-year plan for selling stakes in government companies. This strategy aims to speed up privatisation. The industry body estimates a significant amount could be raised to fuel development. The proposal includes gauging investor interest first and then prioritising companies.

articles.title: State capex loans cross 56% of FY26 target by Jan 5; Centre aims for full utilisation
articles.summary: The Centre has released over ₹83,000 crore to states for capital investment. This is part of the special assistance scheme for capital investment. The government is confident of fully utilizing the allocation by the fiscal year end. The scheme provides interest-free loans to states for capital expenditure.

articles.title: Spain, Germany, Belgium, Poland emerging as key export destinations for India within EU
articles.summary: India's exports to European Union are showing strong growth. Spain is a standout market with significant export increases. Germany continues to be a stable destination for Indian products. Belgium and Poland also show positive export trends. These developments are occurring as India and the EU negotiate a free trade agreement, promising further bilateral trade growth.

articles.title: Explainer: Simplified Income Tax Act, 2025, to come into force from April 1
articles.summary: A new Income Tax Act, 2025, will replace the 1961 law on April 1, simplifying direct tax legislation and reducing its volume by 50%. The revenue-neutral act eliminates the distinction between assessment and previous years, introducing a single 'tax year' framework. Budget 2026-27 changes will be incorporated.

articles.title: Budget 2026-27: In the AI race, India can't afford to jog
articles.summary: India's digital sector is emerging as a crucial "power-lifter" amidst global economic realignments, strengthening domestic resilience and expanding its international footprint. With significant investments in infrastructure and deep technology, India is poised to convert its digital scale into sustained leadership, leveraging its complex ecosystem for AI innovation and securing infrastructure sovereignty.

articles.title: India eyes new markets with US trade deal limbo
articles.summary: India is aggressively seeking trade deals to open markets for exporters and soften the blow of steep US tariffs, as efforts to secure an agreement with Washington remain elusive. And while a free trade agreement (FTA) with New Zealand added little to Indian export growth, it secured $20 billion in foreign investment, increased visa access and showed Washington that New Delhi is willing to compromise.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to attend US critical minerals meet amid China’s supply-chain weaponisation
articles.summary: India is set to participate in a key US-organized meet on critical minerals, with Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to represent the nation. This engagement signals a broader US effort to diversify supply chains away from China's dominance. India will also join the US-led Pax Silica initiative ahead of its AI summit.

articles.title: Budget 2026: States seek higher capex aid, GST loss compensation in pre-Budget talks with Sitharaman
articles.summary: States met with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman ahead of the FY27 budget. They asked for more special assistance for capital investments and help with GST revenue losses. Increased funding for urban and rural schemes was also requested. Support for housing programs and disaster management was highlighted. The minister urged states to undertake reforms for India's developed nation goal by 2047.

articles.title: India, EU FTA talks: ministers say good progress made, full steam in coming days
articles.summary: India and the European Union are moving closer to a free trade agreement. Discussions in Brussels showed good progress with fewer issues remaining. Both sides are committed to a fair and ambitious deal. Negotiations are speeding up to finalize the pact soon. This agreement is crucial for economic ties between India and the EU.

articles.title: India’s record rice crop is set to deepen slide in global prices
articles.summary: India's record rice harvest is flooding the global market, pressuring prices as demand weakens and key buyers impose stricter import rules. Farmers may face significant rate cuts to compete with rivals like Thailand and Vietnam. Analysts predict a potential drop of $15 to $25 per ton by spring due to a lack of immediate African and Middle Eastern interest.

articles.title: India's 2025 rice exports surge to near record as curbs lifted
articles.summary: India’s rice exports rose 19.4% last year to 21.55 million tonnes, the second-highest level on record, after the government lifted all export curbs. Officials said shipments recovered quickly from March as supplies improved on record production and the last restrictions imposed in 2022–23 were removed.

articles.title: Telangana govt to promote $3 trillion economy goal at WEF Davos 2026
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy said the state will actively promote its Telangana Rising 2047 vision and aim for a $3 trillion economy at the World Economic Forum in Davos 2026. The delegation will showcase the state’s transformative growth plans, revisit past investment commitments, and highlight opportunities in innovation, technology, and inclusive development.

articles.title: PM Modi made eight calls in 2025: India rejects US claim on trade deal delay
articles.summary: Modi and Trump have spoken on the phone “on eight occasions during 2025, covering different aspects of our wide-ranging partnership”, external affairs ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said on Friday. Lutnick had said that India was given “three Fridays” to clinch a trade deal with Washington last year and that Modi had to call Trump to close it.

articles.title: RBI trims US treasury holding to below $200 bn amid gold rush
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced its holdings in US Treasuries. This strategic move sees the central bank increasing its gold reserves. The shift aims to diversify foreign exchange reserves. This diversification is a response to global economic uncertainties. India joins other nations in this trend. The RBI's forex reserves remain stable overall.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India may peg nominal growth for FY27 at 10%
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: India's upcoming budget may target a nominal growth rate of around 10 percent. This is an increase from the estimated 8 percent for the current fiscal year. Economic growth is expected to remain strong. Inflation is also projected to rise in the next fiscal year due to base effects.

articles.title: Financial Services secretary flags digital risks, says AI key to tackling mule accounts
articles.summary: The central bank has introduced initiatives such as MuleHunter.ai to combat mule accounts used for fraudulent transactions. The AI tool delivers high accuracy and precision with significantly low false-positive rates and is currently deployed across 20 commercial banks.

articles.title: Mukul Agrawal reshapes Rs 6,500-crore portfolio in Q3: Two new stocks, one exit. Do you own?
articles.summary: Mukul Agrawal has updated his Rs 6,500-crore stock portfolio. He added Hindustan Construction and Sudeep Pharma. Agrawal reduced his stake in Monolithisch and likely exited Stanley Lifestyles. His portfolio includes several multibagger stocks from the past year. These include Osel Devices, Zelio E-Mobility, Monolithisch India, Zota Health Care, and ASM Technologies.

articles.title: Gold prices ease by Rs 300, silver above Rs 2.69 lakh amid geopolitical unrest. Is this a dip worth buying?
articles.summary: Gold prices eased on MCX after hitting record highs, while silver remained firm amid geopolitical tensions. Analysts cite profit booking, strong safe-haven demand and expectations of US rate cuts, with experts advising buying on dips despite elevated volatility.

articles.title: Premier Energies among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: Five stocks in the NSE F O segment, including Premier Energies and Swiggy, saw a sharp rise in futures open interest on January 12, indicating increased trader participation and fresh positioning in the derivatives market.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Day 3: GMP at 46%; issue sees strong subscription. Should you apply?
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal's IPO is seeing robust demand. The issue is attracting strong interest in the grey market, indicating positive investor sentiment. High subscription rates, especially from retail and non-institutional investors, highlight confidence in the offering. The company is India's largest coking coal producer. Experts recommend subscribing for potential listing gains.

articles.title: Ola Electric shares in focus as company rolls out first BESS product ‘Shakti’
articles.summary: Ola Electric shares: The company launched its first residential Battery Energy Storage System, Shakti, from its Krishnagiri Gigafactory, marking its entry into the residential BESS market. Powered by locally developed 4680 Bharat Cells, the product is India’s first of its kind and is designed to provide portable, on-demand energy solutions for households, farms, and businesses.

articles.title: Value buys? Worst-performing India market pushes 25 Nifty stocks below 5-year PE
articles.summary: India's stock market faces challenges, with 25 major Nifty companies now trading below their five-year average price-to-earnings ratios. This valuation shift follows a period of global uncertainty and foreign investor selling. Investors are closely watching upcoming earnings reports to determine if growth justifies current valuations. Market volatility is expected to continue as global factors influence sentiment.

articles.title: Earnings outlook stabilising despite volatility; autos, financials, telecom in focus: Axis MF’s Karthik Kumar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Karthik Kumar says recent market volatility is driven by global uncertainty and FII selling, but earnings trends are stabilising. He sees valuations normalising and expects growth-led sectors to regain leadership. Autos, financials, telecom and industrials remain key overweight bets, while IT and discretionary consumption need earnings confirmation to turn positive.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Why the next phase of global investing may go beyond the US, says Alekh Yadav of Sanctum Wealth
articles.summary: US equity markets have seen strong gains driven by Big Tech and AI. However, valuations are now stretched, with risks building around debt-funded investments and AI revenue growth. Geopolitical tensions also add to market volatility. Experts suggest investors should look beyond the US and diversify their international exposure for future growth opportunities.

articles.title: TCS shares slip marginally after Q3 profit drops 14% YoY. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services reported a year-on-year decline in Q3FY26 profit despite steady revenue growth, driven by one-off costs and wage hikes. Brokerages remain cautious but constructive, citing stable margins, improving demand visibility and growing AI-led deal traction, while largely recommending a neutral-to-positive stance on the stock.

articles.title: HCL Tech shares jump nearly 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
articles.summary: HCL Tech shares: The IT services firm reported an 11% year-on-year decline in consolidated net profit to ₹4,076 crore in the December quarter, even as revenue grew strongly. Revenue from operations rose 13% YoY to ₹33,872 crore, while on a sequential basis profit fell nearly 4% and revenue increased 6% compared to the September quarter.

articles.title: Meesho shares in focus as firm enters logistics business, incorporates subsidiary
articles.summary: Meesho is entering the logistics business by incorporating a new subsidiary. This move is expected to be a key driver for the company's future earnings. BofA Securities has initiated coverage with a Neutral rating, setting a price target of Rs 190. The stock is trading above its IPO price, showing investor interest. This expansion signals Meesho's strategic growth plans.

articles.title: Power Finance Corporation among 4 stocks flash bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend
articles.summary: On January 12, four NSE-listed stocks with a market capitalisation above Rs 10,000 crore featured on the bullish White Marubozu scanner. The candlestick pattern signals strong intraday buying interest, highlighting firm buyer dominance and improving momentum, which may increase the probability of further upside in select stocks.

articles.title: IFCI, IREDA among 5 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: On January 12, five Nifty500 stocks signalled improving momentum after gaining over 3.5% and moving above the 50 mark on the RSI indicator. This technical setup points to strengthening buying interest and potential upside, helping traders identify stocks where momentum appears to be turning positive.

articles.title: India’s debt fund managers turn tactical as returns get harder
articles.summary: India's top debt fund managers are adopting a cautious stance for the year ahead, prioritizing stability and accrual over long-term bets. With the central bank nearing the end of its rate-cut cycle and investor demand subdued, strategies are shifting towards higher cash holdings, state bonds, and shorter corporate debt for better opportunities.

articles.title: Anand Rathi shares in focus as Q3 net profit jumps 30% to Rs 100 crore
articles.summary: Anand Rathi Wealth shares are in focus after a strong December quarter. The company reported a 30% rise in net profit to Rs 100 crore and a 25% jump in revenue to Rs 306 crore. Assets Under Management grew 30% to Rs 99,008 crore. The firm added new clients and saw healthy inflows, demonstrating steady growth.

articles.title: China examines foreign ETF trades after Jane Street India probe
articles.summary: China is examining how foreign firms like Jane Street Group operate in its large ETF market. Regulators want to understand trading activities. This comes after India accused Jane Street of market manipulation. UBS has paused some trades from Jane Street. China's stock market is sensitive to performance. Foreign firms are increasingly active in China's growing ETF sector.

Traders left guessing whether more curbs will hit India options
articles.summary: India's recent crackdown on derivatives successfully curbed excessive options trading that harmed small investors. Traders now await clarity on potential new curbs, particularly regarding weekly contracts on major indices. While these instruments fueled market growth, their elimination could significantly impact trading volumes and hedging strategies, despite a global trend towards shorter expiries.

articles.title: INDO SMC IPO to open with 24% GMP. Check price band, subscription and other details
articles.summary: INDO SMC's Rs 92 crore IPO opens Tuesday, with strong grey market interest indicating investor confidence. The company, a manufacturer of electrical and industrial products, aims to raise funds for plant expansion and working capital. With a price band of Rs 141-149, the issue is set to debut on the BSE SME platform on January 21.

articles.title: Gold eases on profit-booking after breaching $4,600/oz
articles.summary: Gold prices eased on Tuesday after reaching an all-time high, as investors booked profits amid escalating geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainty. The U.S. dollar held near one-month highs following an investigation into the Federal Reserve Chair, while major brokerages anticipate rate cuts. Precious metals like silver, platinum, and palladium also saw declines.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO: Check GMP, review, subscription and other details
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs is launching its IPO for subscription. Early market signs suggest a measured debut rather than a surge. The company operates in connected TV and digital video advertising. Investors are advised to focus on long-term growth. Subscription trends and market stability will be key indicators.

articles.title: Positive Breakout: These 14 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
articles.summary: As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend.

articles.title: Oil prices gain on Iran supply disruption concerns
articles.summary: Oil prices saw a slight increase as concerns over Iran's internal unrest and potential supply disruptions overshadowed anticipated crude supply from Venezuela. Heightened tensions with Iran, including potential U.S. military action and tariffs, are adding a geopolitical risk premium to oil prices. Meanwhile, escalating geopolitical tensions in Ukraine and renewed attacks on the Federal Reserve in the U.S.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank 5:1 stock split: What shareholders need to know before ex-date
articles.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank shareholders must buy shares by today to benefit from the upcoming 5:1 stock split. The bank has set January 14, 2026, as the record date. This move will increase share count fivefold, adjusting the price per share proportionally. Additionally, Anup Kumar Saha joins as Whole-time Director, bringing extensive experience in consumer banking and digital transformation.

articles.title: Dollar wobbles as markets fret about threat to Fed independence
articles.summary: The dollar weakened Tuesday following a criminal probe into Fed Chair Jerome Powell, sparking concerns over central bank independence and U.S. asset faith. Investors reacted by selling dollars and Treasuries, with some seeking refuge in gold. While the market reaction was muted, the investigation raises questions about the Fed's autonomy, a key factor for U.S. ratings.

articles.title: S&P 500, Dow hit closing record highs; Walmart, tech climb
articles.summary: The S P 500 and Dow hit record highs Monday, with tech and Walmart shares climbing despite a Justice Department probe into Fed Chair Powell. Investors largely shrugged off concerns, focusing instead on upcoming earnings and consumer price data. Financials, however, declined after President Trump proposed a credit card interest rate cap.

articles.title: GIFT Nifty up 60 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
articles.summary: Indian equity benchmarks rebounded from Monday's lows, closing in positive territory. Analysts anticipate a sideways market with stock-specific movements as the earnings season commences. The Nifty faces resistance around 26000-26100, with support at 25650, while India VIX saw a 4% increase.

articles.title: Stocks in news: TCS, HCL Tech, Ola Electric, RIL, Just Dial
articles.summary: Markets closed positively despite volatility, with IT majors TCS and HCL Tech reporting profit declines in their December quarter results. Ola Electric launched its first battery energy storage system, Shakti, while Indian Hotels secured trademark registration for the 'Taj' sonic sound. L T will fully acquire L T Sapura Shipping, and Reliance Industries confirmed its battery storage manufacturing plans remain on track.

articles.title: Asian shares rise on valuations, dollar declines
articles.summary: Asian shares surged to near record highs, outperforming the S P 500 as investors shifted focus beyond US markets due to cheaper valuations and unpredictable US foreign policy. Concerns over the Federal Reserve's independence and upcoming US inflation data present key risks this week.

articles.title: Domestic markets bounce back after US ambassador calms trade jitters
articles.summary: Indian stock markets bounced back on Monday, ending a five-day decline. This recovery followed assurances from the US ambassador regarding upcoming trade discussions. Markets had previously fallen due to concerns over potential US tariffs. The Nifty and Sensex both saw gains, recovering from earlier lows. Analysts suggest ongoing trade talks and the upcoming budget will influence market direction.

articles.title: PFC plans public bond issue to raise Rs 5,000 crore
articles.summary: Power Finance Corp is launching a public bond issue to raise up to ₹5,000 crore. This comes after the company cancelled private bond sales due to market volatility. The new issue aims to attract retail investors and offers various maturities. PFC is also benefiting from lower borrowing costs compared to previous private placements.

articles.title: RBI infuses Rs 50,000 crore into system through OMO
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India injected fifty thousand crore rupees into the banking system on Monday. This was done through an open market purchase auction. Participants offered more than double the notified amount. Another similar operation is scheduled for January twenty-second. These measures aim to boost liquidity and stabilize funding rates.

articles.title: Bajaj Housing raises Rs 509 crore via NCDs at 7.10%
articles.summary: Bajaj Housing Finance has successfully raised ₹509 crore through non-convertible debentures. This move follows a period of strong business growth for the company. Their assets under management saw a significant increase of 23% year-on-year. The mortgage lender also reported a substantial rise in disbursements during the third quarter, indicating robust performance and expansion in their operations.

articles.title: NSE shares surge after IPO clouds seem to clear
articles.summary: National Stock Exchange shares climbed past ₹2,000. This surge followed SEBI chief's comments on an upcoming IPO clearance. Investor interest has rekindled. NSE shares saw increased demand and trading volumes. The exchange's IPO is expected soon. This development has boosted sentiment for the unlisted stock.

articles.title: IT Q3 earnings season begins on a strong note as TCS, HCL Tech top estimates
articles.summary: IT sector's Q3 results show a positive start, with TCS and HCL Technologies exceeding revenue and profit expectations. HCL Tech recorded a nine-quarter high in new order bookings, while TCS maintained strong deal flow. Despite sustained new deals, TCS faces a revenue growth deceleration, raising concerns about deal ramp-up amid client delays.

articles.title: Apollo Hospitals demerger is a biz call taken for shareholders, says Suneeta Reddy; rules out family rift
articles.summary: Apollo Hospitals MD Suneeta Reddy says the group’s restructuring is about business strategy, not family dynamics, aiming to unlock value by separating hospital and pharmacy-digital units. She stresses close ties with sister Shobana Kamineni, outlines expansion in metros and Tier-II cities, focus on preventive care, tech-led growth, and mentoring the next generation of leaders.

articles.title: 'India can be global AI use case capital': MeitY secy
articles.summary: India is set to become a global hub for AI applications. The country will foster its own AI infrastructure, including large language models and data centers. This initiative aligns with the goal of democratizing AI resources. India's role as a trusted partner in value chains is recognized. Discussions on global AI policy will take place at an upcoming summit.

articles.title: Why Apple has called on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
articles.summary: The deal allowing Apple to tinto Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses. The partnership will draw upon Google's Gemini technology to customize a suite of AI features dubbed "Apple Intelligence" on the iPhone and other products.

articles.title: OpenAI acquires healthcare startup Torch, deal pegged at $100 million
articles.summary: Torch is a small healthcare technology startup which focusses on unifying fragmented medical data such as lab results, medications, and doctor visit records, into a single, AI-readable system.

articles.title: TCS headcount drops by 11,000 in Q3 after 19,000 in last quarter
articles.summary: At the end of the December quarter, TCS had 582,163 employees, lower than the September quarter’s count of 593,314, the Mumbai-headquartered firm reported. ​In the previous quarter, the company had reported a net reduction of 19,755 employees, taking its total workforce below six lakh.

articles.title: Meta plans to cut about 10% of employees in reality labs business
articles.summary: The cuts to Reality Labs -- which has roughly 15,000 employees -- could be announced as soon as Tuesday. The layoffs would be a fraction of Meta's total workforce of 78,000, but are set to disproportionately affect those in the metaverse unit who work on virtual reality headsets and a VR-based social network, said the people, who asked not to be identified since they were not authorized to discuss confidential decisions. The cuts could end up affecting more than 10% of the division, one of the p

articles.summary: India should aim to become the global use case capital for artificial intelligence (AI) if the adoption of the technology is to be spread widely, electronics and information technology secretary S Krishnan said on Monday.

articles.title: HCLTech Q3 PAT dips 11% to Rs 4,076 crore
articles.summary: HCLTech posted a 3.75% sequential drop in net profit to Rs 4,076 crore, hit by one-time restructuring costs. Revenue exceeded expectations, while AI services grew to $146 million. The company plans to focus on high-growth areas such as AI and semiconductors, maintaining its operating margin guidance at 17-18%.

articles.title: A new gig rises, will it scale up?
articles.summary: As AI models grow more complex, a new white-collar gig workforce has emerged to review and guide systems. A new category of AI-related work is unravelling in India, where professionals are paid not just to label data, but to review, validate, and guide artificial intelligence systems. Who are these humans-in-the-loop? Puran Choudhary explores

articles.summary: Jeffrey Ullman, professor emeritus of computer science at Stanford University and a Turing Award laureate, speaks to Puran Choudhary about the limits of large models, AI risk, and India’s research challenge

articles.title: AI did it in one prompt: Shopify CEO Tobi Lutke builds his own MRI viewer
articles.summary: Lutke’s X post said he used Anthropic’s Claude AI to process DICOM files (the standard file format used in healthcare to store and transmit MRIs, CT scans, and X-rays) from an MRI scan. The AI-based system organised radiology reports and images and generated a browser-based tool, which ran on his computer.

articles.title: Google and Apple enter into multi-year AI deal for Gemini models
articles.summary: Alphabet said on Monday that it has signed a multi-year agreement with Apple, under which Apple’s next generation of AI models will be built using Google’s Gemini technology.

articles.summary: Bluecopa has raised $7.5 million led by Singapore-based Analog Partners, with participation from existing investors Blume Ventures and Dallas Venture Capital. In a statement, the startup said it will scale its AI-native platform for autonomous finance operations as enterprises look to move away from fragmented, batch-driven finance systems.

articles.summary: IT majors TCS and HCLTech saw profits come under pressure in Q3 despite revenue growth. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Ride-hailing firm inDrive forays into grocery delivery in Pak, launches in-app ads in top markets
articles.summary: Advertising on inDrive is being unveiled across Mexico, Colombia, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Egypt, and Morocco. This will focus on in-app ads during the waiting period and while the passengers are en route, the company said. inDrive is scaling grocery delivery in Pakistan, its second market after Kazakhstan, through a partnership with local dark-store operator Krave Mart, which received an investment from inDrive in December 2024.

articles.title: UK regulator launches investigation into X over Grok sexualised imagery
articles.summary: Britain’s media regulator Ofcom has opened an investigation into Elon Musk’s X over alleged misuse of its Grok AI chatbot to generate sexual deepfakes. The probe follows political pressure after Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the content as unlawful. Ofcom will assess whether X failed to protect UK users, particularly children, from illegal material.

articles.title: ETtech Explainer: What OpenAI’s new ‘health’ feature means for its second-largest user market, India
articles.summary: The feature is being presented as a helper, not a medical expert. OpenAI says it is meant to assist users in understanding reports, preparing questions for doctors, and keeping track of overall wellbeing, rather than offering diagnoses or treatment.

articles.title: Dharana Capital raises $250 million for second India-focussed fund for tech, consumer bets
articles.summary: With the new fund, its total assets under management are at $450 million. It said that its limited partner (LP) base includes US university endowments, healthcare companies and other non-profit organisations.

articles.title: Malaysia, Indonesia become first to block Musk's Grok over AI deepfakes
articles.summary: The moves reflect growing global concern over generative AI tools that can produce realistic images, sound and text, while existing safeguards fail to prevent their abuse. The Grok chatbot, which is accessed through Musk's social media platform X, has been criticised for generating manipulated images, including depictions of women in bikinis or sexually explicit poses, as well as images involving children.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: India fast-tracks key reforms to shield itself from US tariffs
articles.summary: In its final parliament session of the year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through major economic reforms aimed at boosting growth amid trade challenges. Parliament approved bills allowing private investment in nuclear energy, full foreign ownership of insurance firms, and a unified securities market code.

articles.title: India valuations fair, earnings key to upside over next 12 months: Mark Matthews
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are poised for steady, healthy growth, driven by the gradual payoff of fiscal and monetary stimulus. While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

articles.title: Catching the Market’s Swing: How traders ride market moves across India, US and global bourses
articles.summary: Swing trading sits comfortably between long-term investing and high-frequency day trading, appealing to market participants who want to capture short- to medium-term price movements without being glued to screens all day.

articles.title: Eternal shares jump 4% on hopes of increased MSCI weightage
articles.summary: Majority of the analysts covering Eternal continue to have a "buy" rating on the stock. 29 out of the 33 analysts have a "buy" rating, while the other four have a "sell" recommendation.

articles.title: China scrutinses foreign ETF trades following Jane Street India investigation
articles.summary: Jane Street was the biggest foreign ETF market maker through the country’s qualified foreign investor program as of June 30, followed by the Amsterdam-based Optiver and US firms Susquehanna International Group and Hudson River Trading, according to Bloomberg Intelligence. Jane Street accounts for less than 2% of overall ETF trading in mainland China, according to a person briefed on the matter.

articles.summary: Minnesota, Minneapolis, and St. Paul sued the Trump administration over an ICE surge after Renee Good's fatal shooting, sparking protests and calls to halt federal immigration tactics.

articles.summary: About 15,000 nurses are involved in the strike, according to their union, the New York State Nurses Association. The hospitals remained open, hiring droves of temporary nurses to try to fill the labour gap.

articles.summary: Ashwini Vaishnaw joined the Critical Minerals Ministerial Meeting in Washington led by Scott Bessent, focusing on supply chain resilience amid China's dominance in mineral refining.

articles.title: India’s income tax slabs explained: How much tax will you pay in FY2025-26?
articles.summary: India follows a progressive tax system, where income is taxed slab by slab, not at a flat rate. Under the new tax regime for FY 2025-26, revised slabs, higher exemption limits and the Section 87A rebate can significantly reduce tax outgo for many earners. This photo story breaks down the slabs with simple examples to show how tax is actually calculated and why slab awareness matters for take-home pay.

articles.title: OpenAI acquires healthcare startup Torch to unify your medical data
