articles.summary: As rumours that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi could dissolve parliament and hold elections emerged, the yield on 30-year bonds increased by 12 basis points to 3.52%, while 10-year bond futures dropped by 71 ticks.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs' ₹1,789 crore IPO opens today: Analysts advise whether to subscribe or skip
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs has fixed the price band for its issue between ₹343 to ₹361 per share. Retail investors can bid for a minimum lot of 41 shares, requiring an investment of ₹14,801 at the upper end of the band, and in multiples thereafter. 10% of the issue has been reserved for retail investors.

articles.title: Iran’s Bazaar merchants lead anti-government protests amid economic crisis
articles.summary: Iran’s economic turmoil has pushed the country’s bazaar merchants, once the backbone of the 1979 Islamic Revolution, into open protest. Rising inflation, a collapsing rial, and the Revolutionary Guards’ control over key sectors have intensified public anger, turning economic frustration into a political challenge for Tehran.

articles.title: ‘Pax Silica’ invitation shows India’s rising influence in AI and critical minerals: IT Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: India’s inclusion in the US-led ‘Pax Silica’ initiative and critical minerals discussions underscores its growing reputation as a reliable partner in global supply chains. Officials say this recognition aligns with India’s ambition to become a world hub for AI applications.

articles.title: Meta names former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chairman
articles.summary: Facebook owner Meta has named Dina Powell McCormick, a former Trump administration adviser and long-time finance executive, as president and vice chairman of the tech giant.

articles.title: Apple and Google confirm multiyear deal for AI technology, Siri
articles.summary: In the statement, the companies said that Apple would maintain its privacy standards by continuing to run its AI services on consumers’ devices or via Private Cloud Compute — a secure online system. The Google technology will help support a new version of Siri that is due this year.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas under Trump administration, marking record crackdown
articles.summary: The U.S. State Department has intensified its visa enforcement under President Trump, revoking more than 100,000 visas, including student and specialised visas. New vetting measures target overstays, criminal offences, and perceived security threats, reflecting the administration’s strict approach to immigration.

articles.title: Cuba's Diaz-Canel says there are no current talks with US government
articles.summary: Cuban President Miguel DiazCanel said on Monday there are no talks with the U.S. government, in an apparent response to comments by President Donald Trump suggesting the two long-time foes were in conversations.

articles.title: No formal India-US trade talks scheduled this week despite Ambassador Gor’s remarks: Sources
articles.summary: Despite US Ambassador Sergio Gor signalling progress on India-US trade talks, Indian government sources say no formal discussions are scheduled this week. Informal engagement continues, and India’s participation in the US-led PAX Silica Initiative has boosted critical mineral stocks.

articles.title: Advance payment under 'Ladki Bahin' scheme barred during poll code: Maharashtra poll body
articles.summary: The SEC’s clarification came after it received several complaints following media reports claiming that beneficiaries of the scheme would receive ₹3,000- covering the December and January instalments- in their bank accounts before January 14 as a Makar Sankranti gift.

articles.title: Navi Mumbai to have 1,148 polling stations for January 15 civic polls; 9.50 lakh eligible to vote
articles.summary: Nearly 9.50 lakh voters are eligible to exercise their franchise during the January 15 polls to the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC), which will see a multi-member panel system to elect 111 corporators across 28 wards, officials said on Monday.

articles.title: Ahead of IPO, Amagi Media Labs mobilises ₹805 cr from anchor investors
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs raised ₹805 crore from anchor investors ahead of its ₹1,789-crore IPO, with SBI MF, ICICI Prudential MF, and HDFC MF among key participants. IPO opens January 13.

articles.title: JP Morgan leases 2.71 lakh sq ft office space from Cowrks in Mumbai at ₹9 cr monthly rent
articles.summary: The starting monthly rent is ₹339.4 per sq ft translating into ₹9.23 crore for a month.

articles.title: CII asks govt to invest in railways and factories, cut fuel taxes, and put money back in people’s pockets
articles.summary: As Budget Day approaches, industry body CII is calling for a sharp increase in infrastructure spending, a renewed PPP push, and structural reforms in taxation and financing to revive consumption and strengthen manufacturing competitiveness.

articles.title: India Inc wants a GST-style customs reboot in Budget 2026 to cut delays and unlock cash
articles.summary: Industry experts say a GST-style overhaul of customs—covering duty slab rationalisation, deeper digitisation, and a one-time amnesty for legacy disputes—could significantly reduce clearance delays, unlock stuck working capital, and improve India’s trade competitiveness in the coming years.

articles.title: RBI notifies Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026
articles.summary: RBI’s new Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026, bar residents from participating in guarantees involving non-residents unless FEMA-compliant, expand guarantee definitions, and mandate quarterly reporting through AD banks with penalties for delays.

articles.title: Cheaper food drags retail inflation down, but the relief may be short
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities Chief Economist Suvodeep Rakshit said the December print gives the RBI comfort ahead of its February 6 MPC policy meeting, as inflation remains well below the lower bound of the target range.

articles.title: India's inflation at three-month high in December, but undershoots poll
articles.summary: India’s retail inflation came in at 1.33% in December, below CNBC-TV18 estimates, as soft food prices offset sequential pressure across rural, urban and core consumption segments.

articles.title: Indian banks look strongest in 15 years, but Crisil flags these risks
articles.summary: Krishnan Sitaraman, Chief Ratings Officer at Crisil Ratings, said the agency is closely monitoring pressure points, especially export-oriented sectors with exposure to the US market.

articles.title: The anatomy of India’s consumer sector: Has policy finally met behaviour?
articles.summary: Q3FY26 shows cautious recovery in India’s consumption, with rising credit card spends, strong rural auto sales, FMCG volume growth, and digital transactions, but urban demand remains subdued.

articles.title: Textile exporters struggle as US tariff pain drags on
articles.summary: Pallab Banerjee, MD & Group President of Pearl Global, said that many smaller textile players are likely to exit the business if the situation does not improve soon, which could lead to job losses and some factory closures in India.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026: Here is all you need to know about this crucial document on state of the economy
articles.summary: Presented in Parliament a day before the Budget, the Economic Survey is best described as India’s economic report card and roadmap rolled into one. It reviews how the economy performed over the fiscal year, from growth, inflation, and jobs to trade and fiscal health — and flags challenges and opportunities.

articles.title: Donald Trump denies role in DoJ's investigation into Fed chair Jerome Powell
articles.summary: Trump denied any role in DOJ subpoenas tied to the Federal Reserve as Powell warned of political pressure and lawmakers raised concerns about the Fed’s independence.

articles.title: Finance Minister chairs pre-Budget consultation with States, UTs ahead of Budget 2026
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman chaired a pre-Budget meeting in New Delhi with States and Union Territories ahead of the 2026–27 Union Budget, set for February 1, marking her ninth presentation.

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM Shaktikanta Das highlights India's resilience amid global shocks, outlining challenges and strategies for Viksit Bharat and continued economic growth.

articles.title: Government plans changes to National Highways Act to fast-track road projects
articles.summary: The government is considering amendments to the National Highways Act to ease land acquisition, cut litigation and speed up highway construction, with proposals likely to be tabled in Parliament’s Budget Session.

articles.title: CBIC flags fake GST notices, advises taxpayers to verify DIN
articles.summary: The CBIC on Friday flagged fake GST notices being sent to businesses and asked taxpayers to report such frauds immediately.

articles.title: US adds fewer jobs than expected in December, unemployment rate declines
articles.summary: US job growth cooled sharply in December, with weak hiring, downward revisions and mixed labour signals, even as falling unemployment and strong consumption kept the broader economic outlook resilient.

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification
articles.summary: India’s US Treasury holdings fell 21% to $190.7 billion dollars in 2025, reflecting a strategic shift toward gold and non-dollar assets amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: UBS explains why the rupee’s troubles may not be over yet
articles.summary: UBS’s Rohit Arora expects the rupee to remain under pressure, pegging dollar-rupee at 94 for the year due to weak capital flows, current account concerns and a recovering US dollar. He said any trade deal-led support may be temporary, with limited upside for the rupee. UBS remains more positive on the Chinese renminbi among Asian currencies.

articles.title: India’s consumption recovery: When Goldman Sachs expects demand to pick up
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

articles.title: GDP to grow by 7.5 pc in FY26, says SBI report
articles.summary: The First Advance Estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) on Wednesday put GDP growth in 2025-26 at 7.4 per cent as compared to 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal. The RBI has projected the growth rate at 7.3 per cent.

articles.title: Sanctions rhetoric vs market reality: Why oil prices may stay soft and Indian refiners could still gain
articles.summary: As Washington sharpens its sanctions language on Russian oil, analysts caution that structural oversupply, rising global inventories and pragmatic enforcement limits are likely to keep crude prices under pressure. For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: RBI data shows credit card spends growing, but pace moderates after festive season
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending remained in double digits in November despite post-festive moderation, driven by rising card penetration and strong e-commerce demand, while per-card spends eased and public sector banks gained market share, RBI data shows.

articles.title: US employment anomaly, not geopolitics, clouds 2026 global outlook: JPMorgan’s Aziz
articles.summary: Jahangir Aziz, Head of Emerging Markets Economic Research at JPMorgan, warned that without a revival in private capital expenditure, India’s growth will remain dependent on cyclical, government-led stimulus rather than shifting to a sustainable, higher growth trajectory.

articles.title: Substantial rise in wealth of Indian-origin adults in UK over past decade: Study
articles.summary: Median wealth rose "substantially" for Indian-origin adults in the UK even as the wealth gap between ethnic groups in the country widened significantly over the past decade, new research by the London School of Economics (LSE) has revealed.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP estimates hold up as economists assess what lies beneath
articles.summary: India’s FY26 GDP growth estimate of 7.4% reassures economists, but softer nominal expansion, fiscal maths and base effects explain why the headline number only tells part of the story.

articles.title: GDP growth to slip to 6.8% in FY27, limited scope for rate cuts: Report
articles.summary: A report by Goldman Sachs further said inflation is likely to firm up, leaving limited scope for the Reserve Bank to cut rates further.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP at 7.4% looks strong, but economists caution on soft nominal growth
articles.summary: India’s FY26 real GDP growth of 7.4% meets expectations, but economists warn that weaker nominal growth could weigh on earnings, fiscal math and market sentiment despite headline resilience.

articles.title: India’s 'Goldilocks' run to continue for next two years; FY27 growth likely at 6.5-7%: EAC-PM Chair
articles.summary: 'India has entered into FTAs with various trade partners which is contributing to diversification of exports. This adds to the overall resilience of exports,' the EAC-PM Chairman said.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: PHDCCI calls for easier credit, lower compliance costs for MSMEs
articles.summary: Interest subvention, higher MUDRA limits and tax audit exemption for micro units among key asks

articles.title: India FY26 GDP first advance estimates see real growth at 7.4%, nominal GDP misses poll
articles.summary: In the first formal step towards framing the Union Budget, India’s FY26 GDP advance estimates peg real growth at 7.4%, driven by services, while nominal growth is seen at 8%.

articles.title: Inside Boeing’s factories: How the aircraft maker is trying to fix its safety and quality crisis
articles.summary: From slowing production to tightening inspections, Boeing is reshaping how its jets are built as regulators keep a close watch. A CNBC-TV18 visit across the aircraft maker’s US factories reveals how changes on the shop floor are aimed at preventing past mistakes from recurring.

articles.title: TCS job cuts now bigger than the entire workforce of many Nifty 50 firms
articles.summary: TCS has cut over 30,000 jobs in six months as profits slide, costs rise and AI-led restructuring accelerates across India’s largest IT employer globally base.

articles.title: Bluecopa raises $7.5 million to kill month-end closures: How the money will reshape finance teams
articles.summary: As CFOs grapple with real-time reporting demands and shrinking tolerance for errors, Hyderabad-based Bluecopa is betting that the traditional month-end close is obsolete. Backed by fresh Series A funding, the AI-native fintech is scaling its autonomous finance platform to help enterprises move from retrospective number-crunching to continuous, always-on financial operations.

articles.title: Top Stories | India-US talks in focus, TCS earnings in line, HCLTech beats, CPI inches up and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Tata Steel secures interim relief extension in ₹1,900 crore and ₹2,410 crore demand matters
KPI Green Energy inks ₹4,000-crore pact with Gujarat govt for RE projects
articles.summary: KPI Green Energy signs a ₹4,000-crore pact with the government of Gujarat for renewable energy projects at Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference; shares closed lower at ₹445.45 on January 12.

articles.title: Sical Logistics bags ₹4,038-crore contract from South Eastern Coalfields
articles.summary: Sical Logistics has secured a ₹4,038 crore contract from South Eastern Coalfields for the Porda Chimtapani open cast project in Raigarh, Chhattisgarh, to be executed over 4,214 days; the contract is a standard domestic deal with no related party involvement.

articles.title: NLC India board okays listing of green arm NIRL, declares interim dividend
articles.summary: NLC India Limited board clears up to 25% stake dilution in NLC India Renewables (NIRL), announces ₹3.60 per share interim dividend and record date of January 16, 2026; okays ₹66.6-crore investment in NIRL.

articles.title: Anand Rathi Wealth Q3 Results | Net profit up 29% on strong revenue growth, digital wealth AUM rise
articles.summary: Mutual fund distribution revenue grew 21% YoY to ₹366 crore, supported by net inflows of ₹10,078 crore, up 10% from the previous year. Equity mutual fund net inflows increased 4% YoY to ₹6,082 crore. The company reported an annualised return on equity (ROE) of 47%.

articles.title: PSP Projects wins ₹61-crore arbitration award from Bhiwandi Nizampur Municipal Corporation
articles.summary: PSP Projects Ltd has won an arbitration award against Bhiwandi Nizampur Municipal Corporation, with BNCMC directed to pay ₹61.44 crore plus accrued interest within 60 days, failing which interest at 11% per annum will apply.

articles.title: TVS Supply wins 3-year Daimler India contract for warehouse management in Chennai
articles.summary: TVS Supply Chain Solutions has secured a three-year contract from Daimler India Commercial Vehicles to manage in-plant warehouse operations in Chennai, deploying 700 employees and leveraging IoT, automation, predictive analytics, and digital dashboards to enhance efficiency and inventory management.

articles.title: Supervision needs to shift from periodic snapshots to continuous awareness: RBI dy guv
articles.summary: Swaminathan J urges banks to boost operational discipline and data governance, stressing continuous supervision and resilience amid digital era challenges at the College of Supervisors conference.

articles.title: Credit-deposit ratio of banks rises to 82 pc: Report
articles.summary: India's Credit-Deposit ratio rose from 53% in 2000-01 to 82% in December 2025, with SBI Research noting strong bank asset growth, PSBs revival, and doubling of banking employment.

articles.title: How rupee movements affect overseas education costs & remittance decisions
articles.summary: Currency volatility impacts Indian students' overseas education costs and NRI remittance strategies, with experts highlighting rising financial pressures.

articles.title: India steel exports grow by a third between April-December, govt data shows
articles.summary: The data showed that the world’s second-biggest crude steel producer imported 4.65 million metric tons of finished steel in the same period.

articles.title: NBCC arm HSCC signs MoU with Bharat Electronics for healthcare manufacturing, services
articles.summary: NBCC said its wholly owned subsidiary HSCC has signed an MoU with Bharat Electronics to collaborate across healthcare manufacturing and services, including medical devices, healthcare IT, project execution, joint procurement and support services, with project-specific agreements to follow.

articles.title: JTL Industries bags PSTCL order for transmission towers; Stock hits 20% upper circuit
articles.summary: JTL Industries received a 220kV transmission tower order from Punjab State Transmission Corporation Limited, boosting its stock by 20 percent to ₹61.89 on the NSE amid strong investor optimism.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank appoints Anup Kumar Saha as whole-time Director
articles.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank appoints Anup Kumar Saha as whole-time Director. Saha joins from Bajaj Finance and will oversee consumer banking, marketing, and data analytics after regulatory approval.

articles.title: Life insurers post nearly 40% growth in December premiums after GST relief
articles.summary: India’s life insurance new business premiums grew 39.5% in December, driven by LIC and private firms such as SBI Life, HDFC Life, and ICICI Prudential.

articles.title: Adani Group to invest ₹1.5 lakh crore in Kutch, boost energy and port capacity
articles.summary: "We will complete our Khavda project and commission the full 37 GW capacity by 2030, and we will also double our port capacity at Mundra in 10 years,” he said

articles.title: Who controls creativity in the AI age? Inside advertising’s biggest power shift
articles.summary: As AI, influencers and data-led platforms reshape advertising, India’s top creative leaders argue that the real battle is no longer about who makes content faster, but who can build brands with consistency, craft and cultural relevance in a fragmented digital economy.

articles.title: Budget: CII suggests expedited, demand-led approach for privatisation of public sector enterprises
articles.summary: CII urged the government to mobilise resources through a calibrated approach to privatisation, focusing on sectors where private participation can enhance efficiency, technology infusion, and global competitiveness.

articles.title: Himachal's fish production likely to reach 19,000 metric tonnes in FY26: CM
articles.summary: "For decades, Himachal Pradesh has been known as the ’fruit bowl’ of the country, but as of today, it is charting a new course toward becoming a hub of blue prosperity,” the chief minister said

articles.title: NTPC to set up coal-to-SNG project at ₹10,000 cr capex in Chhattisgarh
articles.summary: The company is looking for technology tie-ups for various processes, like coal beneficiation and gasification, to produce synthetic natural gas.

articles.title: Micro-fertiliser industry seeks uniform 5 pc GST, faster credit refunds ahead of Budget
articles.summary: The industry body said manufacturers are facing an inverted duty structure on certain inputs where raw materials and services attract higher GST than finished products

articles.title: Signatureglobal Q3 Update: Pre-sales fall 27% YoY, collections rise 14%
articles.summary: The company's net debt stood at ₹1,020 crore at the end of the first nine months of FY26.

articles.title: At pre-Budget meet in Delhi, Sawant seeks equitable Centre-state funding for Goa
articles.summary: ”Goa’s perspectives, demands, and developmental requirements were presented, with a focus on sustaining momentum in critical infrastructure projects,” he said.

articles.title: Goa records highest tourist footfall at 1.08 crore in 2025; foreign visitors top 5 lakh
articles.summary: Goa recorded 1.02 crore domestic tourists and 5.17 lakh foreign tourists, aggregating to 1.08 crore total arrivals, the state Tourism Department said in its data released on Sunday.

articles.title: Techno Paints appoints Sachin Tendulkar as brand ambassador
articles.summary: Sachin Tendulkar has been appointed as the brand ambassador of the paint manufacturer for three years, a move expected to help the company expand across the country.

articles.title: PhonePe Payment Gateway adds 'Bolt' to secure Visa, Mastercard payments via app
articles.summary: PhonePe PG Bolt now enables secure one-click Visa and Mastercard payments via device tokenisation, improving convenience and merchant success.

articles.title: UAE probe urges DGCA to tighten regulatory oversight after Air India Express tail-strike incident
articles.summary: The UAE investigation has pointed to gaps in crew coordination, energy management and landing procedures, calling for stronger regulatory supervision and enhanced pilot training to prevent recurrence of tail-strike incidents during critical landing phases.

articles.title: Manappuram Finance denies report on delay in Bain deal, says RBI approval pending
articles.summary: Manappuram Finance said its Bain Capital–linked transaction is on track, with RBI approvals for management changes received and final approval pending; shares dropped 5.33% to ₹293 on the BSE.

articles.title: Phoenix Mills Q3 Update: Retail consumption up 20%, office occupancy at 77%
articles.summary: Phoenix Mills reported 20% YoY growth in Q3 FY26 retail consumption to ₹4,787 crore, improved office occupancy to 77% with 1.20 msft leased in 9M FY26, steady hospitality performance with RevPAR growth at The St. Regis Mumbai, and higher residential sales of ₹140 crore in the quarter.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets' worst week in four months, MF inflows ease, mixed US jobs data & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: RailTel to establish greenfield data centre in Addis Ababa for Ethiopian govt
articles.summary: RailTel Corporation of India Ltd will establish a greenfield data centre for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ethiopia in Addis Ababa, a company's press note said on Friday.

articles.title: Globus Spirits Q3 PAT jumps multifold at ₹30.44 crore
articles.summary: Revenue from operations in the quarter under review stood at Rs 938.36 crore as against ₹882.96 crore in the year-ago period, it added.

articles.title: Practical beauty brand Antinorm raises ₹28 crore in seed round, CEO expects 5-10x growth
articles.summary: Backed by Fireside Ventures, Antinorm is betting on multifunctional, climate-focused beauty products to address the needs of time-starved urban women, as the young brand scales its portfolio, deepens customer engagement and sharpens its direct-to-consumer play.

articles.title: Airbus beats aircraft delivery goal after late December rally
articles.summary: Airbus also recorded 889 net orders last year, taking its backlog to 8,754 aircraft. The planemaker signed deals for more than 140 of the narrowbody A320 jets from Chinese airlines and a lessor in the last week of December.

articles.title: Former US Fed chairs, policymakers decry ‘unprecedented’ Trump assault on Powell
articles.summary: Former Federal Reserve chairs and senior policymakers have condemned the Trump administration’s criminal probe of Jerome Powell, calling it an unprecedented attack on central bank independence with serious economic consequences.

articles.title: Alphabet’s rise to $4 trillion cements status as AI trade winner
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. surpassed a $4 trillion market cap, overtaking Apple Inc. and trailing Nvidia Corp. after Apple chose Gemini for Siri. Berkshire Hathaway Inc. recently invested in Alphabet.

articles.title: Dow falls over 400 points after criminal investigation into Fed Chair Powell
articles.summary: The Dow fell over 400 points on Monday as the US Department of Justice opened a criminal probe into Fed Chair Jerome Powell. Trump’s pressure on monetary policy and calls to cap credit card rates added to market jitters.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO to open next week, targets valuation of ₹7,400 crore
articles.summary: People familiar with the matter told PTI that Shadowfax is targeting a post-market valuation of about Rs 7,400 crore, lower than previous estimates of Rs 8,500 crore, in what is being positioned as a more conservative pricing approach aimed at attracting long-term institutional investors.

articles.title: Government's direct tax kitty swells as companies and individuals pay more
articles.summary: India’s net direct tax collections for FY 2025–26 rose 8.82 percent to ₹18,37,898.32 crore by January 11, 2026, driven by higher corporate and non-corporate tax inflows.

articles.title: Krystal bags ₹275-crore contract to clean up Maharashtra's fast-growing cities
articles.summary: Krystal Integrated Services Ltd won ₹275 crore municipal waste contracts from Vasai–Virar City Municipal Corporation, expanding its sanitation services across Maharashtra’s fast-growing urban region.

articles.title: Stocks to Watch on Jan 13: TCS, HCLTech, Adani Energy, Biocon, NLC India and more
articles.summary: Stocks including TCS, HCL Technologies, Adani Energy, Biocon, NLC India and NBCC will be in focus on Tuesday, January 13, following Q3 earnings announcements and key corporate updates across sectors.

articles.title: Biocon taps markets with ₹4,150-crore QIP with floor price at ₹387.74 per share
articles.summary: Biocon Limited approved a QIP at ₹387.74 per share, with issue opening on 12 January 2026. Biocon’s subsidiary plans new oncology biosimilars, and Ajanta Pharma inked a semaglutide deal.

articles.title: HCLTech Q3 results: Revenue up 6% QoQ, FY26 growth guidance raised
articles.summary: HCLTech Q3 Results Today: HCL Technologies revised its FY26 guidance, raising constant currency services revenue growth to 4.75-5.25% from 4-5%, with overall CC revenue now expected at 4-4.5% and margins maintained at 17-18%.

articles.title: Bandhan Mutual Fund launches Gold ETF FoF and Silver ETF FoF
articles.summary: The New Fund Offers (NFOs) will open on Monday, January 12, 2026, and close on Tuesday, January 20, 2026

articles.title: Adani Energy keeps the grid humming: collections at 102%, transmission uptime near 100%
articles.summary: Adani Energy Solutions Limited reported robust Q3FY26 performance with 101.75 percent collection efficiency, strong Mumbai and Mundra growth, and new transmission projects including North Karanpura.

articles.title: Ola Electric moves beyond EVs, launches residential BESS 'Ola शक्ति'
articles.summary: Reservations for Ola शक्ति are open on the Ola Electric website at a booking amount of ₹999.

articles.title: Market volatility driven by global risks; banks, autos and IT offer buying opportunities: Centrum PMS
articles.summary: Manish Jain of Centrum PMS said the recent market decline is largely due to global risks, while domestic fundamentals remain stable. He advised long-term investors not to wait for deeper corrections and to consider banks, autos and large-cap IT stocks as earnings improve, adding that Q3 results, the rupee, interest rate stability and the upcoming Union Budget will be key drivers for markets in the near term.

articles.title: Gold and silver price targets: Where are they headed next?
articles.summary: Surendra Mehta, Secretary of the India Bullion and Jewellers Association, said that each decline in prices should be seen as a buying opportunity, noting that gold and silver are likely to remain firm as long as major global powers such as China, Russia and the US fail to find common ground on key economic and geopolitical issues.

articles.title: What’s driving bonds today: RBI boost, lighter supply, and a big PFC issue
articles.summary: Power Finance Corporation (PFC) has launched the first tranche of its public issue of non-convertible debentures (NCDs), aiming to raise ₹50 billion. The issue opened on Friday (January 9) and is scheduled to close on January 30.

articles.title: TCS Dividend: Tata Group giant announces payout of ₹57 for shareholders
articles.summary: TCS has announced a third interim dividend and a special dividend for financial year 2026. Record date for the same has been fixed as January 17, 2026.

articles.title: BJP delegation meets Karnataka Governor, requests not to give assent to Hate Speech Bill
articles.summary: A delegation of BJP leaders on Monday petitioned Karnataka Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot requesting him not to give assent to the Hate Speech Bill, calling it "draconian", "direct attack on free speech" and "tool for political vendetta".

articles.title: Expelled Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil taken into custody in sexual assault case
articles.summary: Rahul Mamkootathil, Congress-expelled MLA from Palakkad, was taken into custody over a third sexual assault case filed by a Pathanamthitta native.

articles.title: India will one day have hijab-clad woman as PM, says Owaisi; BJP slams his 'irresponsible' remark
articles.summary: Claiming that Muslim women were against wearing hijab as nobody wanted subjugation, he said women in Iran were protesting against this practice.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar, Sharad Pawar’s NCP factions release joint manifesto for upcoming Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad polls
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar’s NCP and NCP (Sharadchandra Pawar) released a joint manifesto for the Pune civic polls, setting aside political differences for the local elections.

articles.title: ED–TMC Face-Off: No one is above the law, interference in probes cannot be justified, say legal experts
articles.summary: Legal voices have weighed in on the escalating confrontation between the Enforcement Directorate and the Trinamool Congress, underlining that investigations cannot be disrupted by political authority, while also pointing to concerns over the breadth and timing of ED powers under the PMLA as the matter moves to the Calcutta High Court.

articles.title: Kerala sees political shifts ahead of April polls
articles.summary: VR Ramakrishnan and Reji Lukose, former CPI(M) members, join BJP ahead of Kerala assembly polls, citing disillusionment with CPI(M) and support for BJP's development politics.

articles.title: ED raids I-PAC office: Mamata to lead protests as court battle set to begin
articles.summary: Addressing the controversy, Banerjee accused the ED of overreach, claiming sensitive party material had been seized during the operation.

articles.title: Will never part ways: Uddhav Thackeray on unity with Raj
articles.summary: Coming together politically for the first time in nearly two decades, Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray last month announced an alliance ahead of the January 15 polls in Mumbai and 28 other municipal corporations in Maharashtra.

articles.title: BJP promises to freeze water, property taxes for 20 years in Navi Mumbai
articles.summary: Navi Mumbai is the only self-sufficient municipal corporation in India regarding water resources, Chavan noted.

articles.title: Mumbai votes on January 15 as BMC polls return after four years
articles.summary: Experts say that despite confusing alliances, voters are unlikely to be influenced by political math. Instead, campaigns are being driven by big narratives such as turning Mumbai into a global city, Hindutva, and Marathi pride.

articles.title: Centre replaced MGNREGA to provide cheap labour to corporates: CM Revanth Reddy
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Thursday claimed that the NDA government at the Centre replaced the MGNREGA with VB G RAM G to ensure availability of cheap labour for big corporates by stripping the rural poor of their right to work.

articles.title: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee obstructed raids in coal smuggling case: ED
articles.summary: The searches were conducted based on a CBI Kolkata FIR filed in November 2020 against Anup Majee and others, and the ED had registered an ECIR in the same month.

articles.title: Vasai Virar civic polls: Voters to get discounts on hotels, transport on polling day
articles.summary: Describing elections as a "festival of democracy," the commissioner appealed to representatives of various associations to support the democratic process by offering incentives to voters on polling day in Maharashtra's Vasai-Virar civic areas.

articles.title: High drama in Kolkata | ED raids I-PAC office, Mamata slams 'nasty, naughty' Amit Shah
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is conducting searches at 15 locations across India in a fake government job scam against an organised gang involved in scamming people by offering fake jobs.

articles.title: BMC elections: Assets of key candidates record sharp rise since 2017
articles.summary: From former Mumbai mayor and Shiv Sena (UBT) candidate Kishori Pednekar to former BJP corporator Neil Somaiya and Congress candidate Sheetal Mhatre, the assets of key candidates contesting in BMC Elections 2026 have seen an exponential growth. Read on:

articles.title: Congress appoints Shivakumar, Baghel, Tirkey as senior observers for Assam polls
articles.summary: The announcement comes close on the heels of appointing Lok Sabha MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra as the chairperson of the screening committee for the Assam polls.

articles.title: Maharashtra civic polls: MMRDA transformed from 'bank' to infrastructure powerhouse, says Fadnavis
articles.summary: ”MMRDA is not a bank; it was created to fund and build infrastructure across the entire metropolitan area,” the Chief Minister stated. Fadnavis said he and his deputy Eknath Shinde have initiated projects worth ₹4 lakh crore through the MMRDA, focusing on water schemes, roads, and an expansive metro network.

articles.title: Aaditya Thackeray accuses Shinde-Fadnavis govt of scams, delays in key Mumbai projects
articles.summary: Aaditya Thackeray accused the Shinde–Fadnavis government of scams, cost overruns and delays in Mumbai’s key infrastructure projects, highlighting stalled roads, Gokhale Bridge issues, and slow progress on the northbound coastal road.

articles.title: Will continue in politics till I have people's blessings: Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: In his second term as chief minister, the 77-year-old Congress leader surpassed Devaraj Urs' record as the longest-serving CM of the state for 2,792 days.

articles.title: Congress suspends 12 councillors over alliance with BJP in Ambernath
articles.summary: Congress suspended 12 Ambernath councillors for allying with BJP in civic polls, sparking controversy in Maharashtra's Mahayuti. Devendra Fadnavis and Eknath Shinde condemned the alliances.

articles.title: BJP's alliance with Congress, AIMIM in Maharashtra: Fadnavis warns of action, Cong suspends local leaders
articles.summary: BJP's alliance with Congress and AIMIM in Maharashtra sparks political chaos as CM Devendra Fadnavis warns leaders and Congress suspends members. Read on:

articles.title: PMK joins AIADMK-led NDA ahead of Tamil Nadu Assembly Elections 2026
articles.summary: PMK joins AIADMK-led NDA for Tamil Nadu Assembly elections 2026, announced by Edappadi Palaniswami and Anbumani Ramadoss in Chennai, aiming to challenge MK Stalin-led DMK.

articles.title: BJP allies with Congress in Ambernath civic body to keep Shinde's Shiv Sena out
articles.summary: Leaders from the Shinde group criticised the BJP for what they termed an “indecent alliance,” accusing it of political betrayal. BJP VP Gulabrao Karanjule Patil rejected the criticism, stating that aligning with the Shinde group allegedly involved in corruption for the past 25 years would have been inappropriate.

articles.title: Aaditya Thackeray flags wildlife risks as Maharashtra clears mining near tiger corridor
articles.summary: The opposition has raised concerns over the economic and environmental trade-offs of the proposed iron ore project, arguing that limited job creation and output do not justify potential damage to critical wildlife corridors in eastern Maharashtra.

articles.title: Jharkhand joins Punjab, Karnataka in opposing Centre’s new VB-G RAM G Act
articles.summary: The Jharkhand government has hardened its stance against the Centre’s new rural employment framework, with Chief Minister Hemant Soren warning that any changes undermining wage security, work guarantees and state autonomy could worsen livelihood stress and migration in tribal and rural regions.

articles.title: Manipur Congress MP alleges ‘illegal buffer zones’ dividing state under centre’s watch
articles.summary: The Congress has sharpened its attack on the Centre over the handling of Manipur, with MP A Bimol Akoijam alleging that buffer zones enforced by central forces are restricting movement and deepening ethnic divisions. The remarks come amid continued security concerns and President’s rule in the violence-hit state.

articles.title: Lucknow court hears arguments in complaint challenging Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
articles.summary: A special MP/MLA court in Lucknow is examining a complaint that questions Rahul Gandhi’s eligibility as a Lok Sabha MP, with the complainant pressing for cancellation of his election from Rae Bareli. The proceedings follow the transfer of the case from Rae Bareli to Lucknow on security grounds.

articles.title: Assam Congress protests draft voter roll, alleges irregularities after special revision
articles.summary: The publication of Assam’s integrated draft electoral roll has triggered political protests, with the Congress alleging manipulation to benefit the ruling BJP. The Election Commission has defended the process, noting that additions and deletions identified during the Special Revision will be addressed during the claims and objections period before the final roll is issued.

articles.title: Economist Amartya Sen not required to attend SIR hearing over spelling error, says EC
articles.summary: The Election Commission (EC) on Tuesday clarified that Nobel laureate Amartya Sen, who was reportedly summoned by the EC over discrepancies in the spelling of his name in the voter list, is not required to appear for a hearing, an official said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pothole-free Mumbai by end-2026 is my promise: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: With civic polls around the corner, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said large-scale concretisation of roads is underway across Mumbai and assured that infrastructure disruptions will ease as projects near completion over the next year.

articles.title: Maharashtra Civic Body Polls: How to find your local voting booth
articles.summary: There are several ways in which voters can find out which polling booth has their name listed.

articles.title: Cancel elections where candidates won unopposed, hold polls again in such wards: Uddhav to SEC
articles.summary: Speaking along side Maharashtra Navnirman Sena president Raj Thackeray, Uddhav claimed the atmosphere in the country is like democracy has been taken over by mobocracy.

articles.title: Introspect before levelling allegations: BJP hits out at Ajit Pawar over 'corruption' allegations
articles.summary: If the Bharatiya Janata Party starts making allegations, it would create serious difficulties for him (Pawar), Chavan said, and advised the NCP chief to "introspect" before levelling allegations.

articles.title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor defends Karnataka govt’s stand on Bengaluru demolition drive
articles.summary: Tharoor said notices had been issued to the residents before the demolition. He said he did not see justice in politically projecting the issue only on the basis that the affected people were poor. "The government has taken a decision to provide temporary accommodation and has promised permanent housing within five to six months,” he said.

articles.title: Thane civic polls see 649 candidates in fray after mass withdrawals
articles.summary: The final list of candidates highlights sharp contrasts across Thane’s wards, with some constituencies witnessing intense competition while others saw significant pruning due to withdrawals and invalid nominations. Election officials said the uneven spread reflects both strategic exits and stricter scrutiny of nomination papers.

articles.title: RSS not a para-military organisation, says Mohan Bhagwat
articles.summary: ”A false narrative is being built against the Sangh. Nowadays, people do not go deep to gather the right information. They do not go to the origin. They go to Wikipedia. Everything is not true out there. Those who go to reliable sources will get to know about the Sangh,” he said.

articles.title: Rajnath Singh flags 'alarming trend' of educated people indulging in anti-national activities
articles.summary: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that an alarming trend of white-collar terrorism is emerging in the country, wherein highly-educated people are engaging in anti-social and anti-national activities.

articles.title: CAG flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt remains elevated
articles.summary: Audit flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt stays above pre-pandemic levels, breaches FRBM targets, disclosure inconsistencies persist, and interest costs strain public finances economy.

articles.title: Key elections, census and more: 10 political developments India will see in 2026
articles.summary: India’s 2026 political calendar is packed with state elections, Census, delimitation debates, key Bills and leadership changes. Here’s what to watch.

articles.title: Congress chief Kharge criticises BJP over ‘plunder, corruption and misgovernance’ in 2025
articles.summary: In a sharp year-end critique, the Congress president accused the NDA government of economic mismanagement, institutional erosion and social distress, arguing that rising inequality, unemployment and governance failures continued to weigh on citizens through 2025.

articles.title: Politicians who went viral in 2025: Speeches, gaffes and defining moments
articles.summary: From PM Modi’s speech after the Pahalgam attack to Zohran Mamdani’s NYC mayor win and Rekha Gupta’s AQI moments, check the politicians who went viral in 2025 and for what.

articles.title: How Delhi, Bihar and VP polls reshaped India's political landscape in 2025
articles.summary: Taken together, the Delhi and Bihar verdicts have further weakened Opposition cohesion at the national level. Repeated electoral setbacks have reduced the Congress's leverage within Opposition alliances, while regional parties are increasingly prioritising state-specific strategies over a unified national front.

articles.title: If Cong high command has to decide on leadership, they should do it before Feb: Parameshwara
articles.summary: G Parameshwara says Congress high command must decide on Karnataka leadership before February budget prep. Siddaramaiah aims for 17th Budget amid CM change speculations. Shivakumar also in contention.

articles.title: Mumbai can’t be separated from Maharashtra: Fadnavis; slams Uddhav and Raj
articles.summary: Devendra Fadnavis at Shivaji Park accused Uddhav and Raj Thackeray of fighting for survival in the BMC election, stressing Mumbai's inseparable link to Maharashtra and Marathi as compulsory.

articles.title: Actor Vijay questioned by CBI for six hours over Karur stampede
articles.summary: Actor-politician says TVK not responsible for tragedy; questioning to continue after Pongal festival

articles.title: India–Germany talks yield wide-ranging pacts, visa-free transit for Indian passport holders announced
articles.summary: India and Germany signed 19 agreements in Gandhinagar, with Modi and Friedrich Merz announcing visa-free airport transit, defence cooperation, green energy funding and expanded skills partnership.

articles.title: AAP MP Raghav Chadha turns into delivery agent for a day, shares video online
articles.summary: Raghav Chadha dressed as a Blinkit delivery agent to highlight gig workers' challenges, urging better conditions and questioning 10-minute delivery pressures in India's quick commerce sector.

articles.title: Shiv Sena releases manifesto for Thane; promises slum-free city, 260-metre iconic viewing tower
articles.summary: The party plans to leverage existing cluster works to provide permanent, high-quality housing to slum dwellers, transforming the city’s landscape into a modern urban centre

articles.title: Nothing to open its first global flagship store in India in 2026
articles.summary: Nothing will open its first global flagship store in India in 2026, marking its offline retail debut outside the United Kingdom. Details on location and launch date are yet to be announced.

articles.title: In Telangana, case against 9, including Sarpanch, for allegedly killing 300 stray dogs
articles.summary: The killings occurred in the villages of Shayampet and Arepally over three days between January 6 and 8.

articles.title: IIT Madras develops ramjet-assisted artillery shells, extends gun range by nearly 50%
articles.summary: The innovation replaces the conventional base-bleed unit in artillery shells with a ramjet engine, providing sustained propulsion after the shell exits the gun barrel.

articles.title: Protest blocks NH-66 in Kasaragod over toll collection, agitators arrested and removed
articles.summary: Over 500 protesters led by Manjeshwar MLA A K M Ashraf blocked NH-66 in Arikady against toll collection, citing NHAI rules. Police arrested Ashraf as toll collection began amid ongoing appeals.

articles.title: AI-driven digitisation errors causing widespread hardship during SIR: Mamata to CEC
articles.summary: Mamata Banerjee wrote to CEC Gyanesh Kumar alleging AI-driven errors in 2002 electoral rolls during SIR, causing hardship for genuine voters and undermining democratic processes in West Bengal.

articles.title: Suraksha Group completes nearly 6,000 Jaypee Wish Town homes, relief in sight for 20,000 buyers
articles.summary: Suraksha Group said it has completed 5,989 homes across 63 towers at Jaypee Wish Town, receiving occupancy certificates for 3,135 units, offering relief to over 20,000 homebuyers awaiting possession.

articles.title: Delhi Airport Express Line hit after theft attempt damages signalling cables, says DMRC
articles.summary: Delhi Metro's Airport Express Line trains run at 25 kmph between Dhaula Kuan and Shivaji Stadium due to signalling cable theft. DMRC plans night repairs and advises passengers to expect delays.

articles.title: DRDO successfully tests man-portable anti-tank missile with top attack capability
articles.summary: DRDO has successfully tested its indigenously developed Man Portable Anti-Tank Guided Missile with top attack capability against a moving target in Maharashtra.

articles.title: Solan fire: Major blaze at old bus stand area in Himachal Pradesh; 8-year-old dead, several feared trapped
articles.summary: Priyansh, an eight-year-old from Bihar, died in a major fire at Old Bus Stand, Arki, Solan. Rescue teams responded, several shops were gutted, and some Nepal residents remain missing.

articles.title: Who is Justice Sujoy Paul? SC collegium picks him as next Calcutta HC Chief Justice
articles.summary: The Supreme Court collegium led by Surya Kant recommended Justice Sujoy Paul as Chief Justice of Calcutta High Court. Justice Paul has roots in Madhya Pradesh and a diverse legal background.

articles.title: India to be invited to Pax Silica Alliance next month, says Sergio Gor | What's the Alliance
articles.summary: India will be invited to join the Pax Silica Alliance next month, marking deeper technology cooperation as talks on trade and secure supply chains for semiconductors and AI continue.

articles.title: CBI questions TVK chief Vijay in Karur stampede case
articles.summary: Vijay, Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief, arrived at CBI headquarters in Delhi for questioning on the Karur stampede case that killed 41 and injured over 60 during his meeting in Karur.

articles.title: PM Modi hosts German Chancellor Merz in Ahmedabad, flies kites on first India visit
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz began their Ahmedabad engagements with a visit to Sabarmati Ashram, followed by the inauguration of the International Kite Festival, ahead of talks marking 25 years of the India–Germany Strategic Partnership.

articles.title: BMC elections: Four former Mumbai mayors, ex-deputy mayors enter high-stakes civic battle
articles.summary: Four former Mumbai mayors and three ex-deputy mayors join the high-stakes BMC elections, with Shiv Sena UBT and BJP fielding top leaders amid intense political rivalry.

articles.title: Vande Bharat Sleeper Express to launch next week: No RAC, higher fares, faster travel
articles.summary: Vande Bharat Sleeper Express launches next week on Howrah–Guwahati route with no RAC, higher fares, faster travel, 16 coaches, advanced features, and quotas for women, senior citizens, and PwDs.

articles.title: Suspected Pakistan drones seen in areas along IB and LoC, India deploys counter-UAS measures
articles.summary: Suspected drones from Pakistan hovered over Samba, Rajouri and Poonch in Jammu and Kashmir on January 11, prompting security forces to launch search operations and fire at the objects.

articles.title: Australia moves India, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan to highest student visa risk category
articles.summary: The Australian government has upgraded India and three neighbouring South Asian countries to Evidence Level 3 under its Simplified Student Visa Framework (SSVF), an internal risk-assessment system used by the Department of Home Affairs to determine the level of evidence required from student visa applicants.

articles.title: NHAI says it sets four Guinness World records on Bengaluru-Vijayawada corridor NH-544G
articles.summary: NHAI set four Guinness World Records on the Bengaluru-Kadapa-Vijayawada Economic Corridor for longest and highest bituminous concrete laying, marking global firsts in highway construction.

articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates remaining phase 2 stretch of metro service in Gandhinagar
articles.summary: PM Modi flagged off a metro service at the Mahatma Mandir metro station in Gandhinagar, marking the inauguration of the service between Sector 10A of Gandhinagar to the Mahatma Mandir convention centre. This stretch, which covers Sachivalaya complex, Akshardham Temple, old Sachivalaya, Sector 16 and 24, is part of phase II of the Metro service connecting Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar.

articles.title: Magh Bihu 2026 Date: Is Bhogali Bihu on January 14 or 15
articles.summary: Magh Bihu or Bhogali Bihu is celebrated with great fervour by the Assamese people. The celebrations begin a day before the Bihu, known as Uruka. Another interesting feature of this festival is the erection of Meji – a towering heap of bamboo, wood and hay.

articles.title: When is Pongal 2026? Date, time, rituals and significance
articles.summary: Pongal is a symbol of respect for the natural world, the abundance of agriculture, and the life-giving force of the Sun. Pongal will be celebrated across January 2026 as a four-day festival.

articles.title: Forces that opposed Somnath temple reconstruction still active, need to defeat them: PM Modi
articles.summary: This is the cycle of time that fundamentalist invaders are now reduced to pages of history, but the Somnath temple still stands tall, PM said.

articles.title: ISRO begins countdown for first launch of the year with PSLV mission
articles.summary: PSLV-C62 rocket to deploy earth observation satellite and 14 co-passenger satellites on January 12.

articles.title: Selfie, 'penny drop' mandated as KYC for crypto customers in India
articles.summary: The directives also discourage Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) and Initial Token Offerings (ITOs), equivalent to IPOs in stock markets, by the exchanges.

articles.title: Reliance to double investments to ₹7 lakh crore over next five years, Mukesh Ambani announces
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani said the company has invested more than ₹3.5 lakh crore over the past five years and announced plans to double that commitment to ₹7 lakh crore over the next five years.

articles.title: Mumbai civic polls: Mahayuti's manifesto promises AI governance, 50% BEST fare cut for women and much more
articles.summary: Mahayuti unveils Mumbai civic poll manifesto promising AI-driven governance, 50 percent BEST fare concession for women, flood-free Mumbai, climate action, and preservation of Marathi culture.

articles.title: AAIB team begins probe into small aircraft crash landing near Rourkela
articles.summary: AAIB began probing the IndiaOne Air Cessna Grand C208B crash near Rourkela, Odisha. Six people were injured but are safe and stable. Odisha government supports the investigation and medical care.

articles.title: In Pics | PM Modi leads Shaurya Yatra, plays damru during Somnath Swabhiman Parv
articles.summary: Somnath Swabhiman Parv is being observed from January 8 to January 11, 2026. The festival marks 1,000 years since Mahmud of Ghazni’s first attack on the Somnath temple in 1026, according to officials. Here are some of the key highlights from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Somnath during the Somnath Swabhiman Parv.

articles.title: PM likely to visit Andamans on Jan 23 to participate in Netaji's birth anniversary celebrations
articles.summary: During his tour to the archipelago, the PM is expected to hoist the national flag and deliver a public speech at the Netaji Stadium, where Subhas Chandra Bose had unfurled the Tricolour on December 30, 1943

articles.title: ED moves Supreme Court flagging Mamata Banerjee's interference during I-PAC raid
articles.summary: ED seeks Supreme Court intervention against Mamata Banerjee for alleged interference in raids at I-PAC and Pratik Jain's home, urging a CBI probe into coal and liquor scam-linked money laundering.

articles.title: Arunachal seeks Centre's support for key infrastructure at pre-budget meet
articles.summary: Placing the state’s requirements before the Centre, the deputy chief minister highlights priority infrastructure projects, including the augmentation of water supply and drainage systems in Itanagar and other urban areas.

articles.title: No govt move to force Apple, Samsung to reveal phone software, industry clarifies
articles.summary: Industry leaders say ongoing consultations on smartphone security are routine, long-running, and focused on clarifying responsibilities across hardware, software, and applications, rather than accessing proprietary intellectual property of handset makers.

articles.title: The rise of cyber fraud in India — and how to stay prepared
articles.summary: India’s digital economy boom has fueled systemic cyber fraud, with AI-driven attacks targeting businesses and merchants. Experts urge stronger strategy, resilience and regulatory compliance.

articles.title: X to open-source new algorithm in 7 days: What it means
articles.summary: Musk said the platform will open-source its entire algorithm, including the code used to recommend organic posts as well as advertisements.

articles.title: Apple takes 20% share as global smartphone shipments rise in 2025; Samsung 19%, Xiaomi 13%
articles.summary: Global smartphone shipments rose 2% year-on-year in 2025, driven by stronger demand and economic momentum in emerging markets, with Apple leading the market as manufacturers navigated tariff risks, Counterpoint Research said.

articles.title: Google partners Walmart, Shopify and others for AI-powered shopping — how will it work
articles.summary: UCP is a result of Google's partnership with major retailers like Shopify, Etsy, Wayfair, Target and Walmart.

articles.title: MeitY says no plan to seek smartphone source code from Apple or Samsung, clarifies security talks
articles.summary: MeitY denies Reuters report stating India might mandate Apple, Samsung and others to share source code, clarifies only routine cybersecurity consultations are ongoing.

articles.title: Indonesia becomes first country to block Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot, here’s why
articles.summary: Indonesia has blocked access to Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot over concerns about AI-generated sexual content, becoming the first country to restrict the tool.

articles.title: Apple shares on pace to match longest losing streak since 1991
articles.summary: The iPhone maker fell as much as 1.1% on Friday, putting the stock on track for an eighth-straight losing session.

articles.title: Tech wrap this week: Motorola introduces Signature, Razr Fold; Redmi debuts Pad 2 Pro 5G
articles.summary: Motorola launched its premium Signature series and the new Razr Fold book-style foldable at CES 2026.

articles.title: CES 2026: Lenovo, Dell and others preview the next wave of consumer tech
articles.summary: From televisions and laptops to robots, CES 2026 offered an early look at the design trends and hardware shifts set to shape consumer tech in the years ahead.

articles.title: India considering legal action against Elon Musk’s Grok after explicit content row
articles.summary: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology is evaluating legal options after expressing dissatisfaction with X’s explanation on the circulation of explicit content linked to Grok, raising broader questions over platform accountability and safe harbour protections.

articles.title: X restricts Grok image tool to paid users amid backlash over sexualised AI content
articles.summary: After the Indian government held the social media company accountable over the "unlawful" content last week, X rejected systemic flaw and blamed it on user behaviour.

articles.title: AI’s memory hunger is reshaping the chip market — driving up costs for everyone
articles.summary: AI’s explosive demand for memory has turned DRAM from a background component into a critical bottleneck. As chipmakers prioritise AI workloads, supply is tightening and costs are rising across the global technology industry.

articles.title: Advertorial | Inside Wadhwani AI: Building artificial intelligence for India's public systems
articles.summary: The past few years have reinforced a simple truth: deploying AI in public systems is a long-term commitment, driven by iterative cycles of doing and learning. Across health, education, and agriculture, Wadhwani AI’s impact is a consequence of sustained engagement.

articles.title: Elon Musk's X faces possible UK ban over sexualised AI images
articles.summary: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the incident as “disgraceful and unacceptable,” saying such content would not be tolerated. He stressed that the platform must take responsibility and rein the situation in, adding that media regulator Ofcom has the government’s full backing to act.

articles.title: AI Overviews, suggested personalised replies and more: What Gmail in Gemini era means
articles.summary: The Gmail update, announced by Google CEO Sundar Pichai on X, includes AI Overviews, Suggested Replies, Proofread, and AI Inbox, among other features.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI will invest 20 billion dollars in the MACROHARDRR data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, promising jobs but facing environmental concerns from NAACP and local groups.

articles.title: DeepSeek's AI gains traction in developing nations, Microsoft report says
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, is boosting AI adoption in developing nations with its free, open-source models, challenging OpenAI and extending Chinese influence where Western platforms are limited.

articles.title: Lucid, Nuro and Uber unveil production-ready robotaxi at CES 2026
articles.summary: With Lucid, Nuro and Uber unveiling production-ready robotaxis, the race to make driverless rides mainstream in the US is clearly speeding up. The unveiling at the CES technology conference in Las Vegas places the trio, alongside Alphabet's Waymo and Elon Musk's Tesla, among others.

articles.title: China to probe Meta’s $2 bn acquisition of AI startup Manus amid rising tech curbs
articles.summary: China’s Ministry of Commerce is investigating Meta’s acquisition of Manus over compliance concerns, highlighting increased scrutiny of foreign tech deals and AI sector regulations.

articles.title: Modi urges ethical, inclusive AI as India’s start-ups take centre stage ahead of global summit
articles.summary: Prime minister tells founders they are “co-architects of India’s future” and calls for home-grown models rooted in local languages and values.

articles.title: This lollipop plays music inside your head
articles.summary: Lava Tech Brands unveiled Lollipop Star at CES 2026, a candy using bone-conduction tech to play music inside your head, featuring tracks by Ice Spice, Akon, and Armani White.

articles.title: CES 2026: Samsung unveils the Galaxy Z Trifold, Merach launches UltraTread T70 Aura and Nylo
articles.summary: In its latest step in foldable innovation, Samsung unveiled the Galaxy Z Trifold at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces ChatGPT Health: What is it and how it works
articles.summary: OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Health, a private, secure space where users can connect medical records and wellness apps to manage health information.

articles.title: Arm launches 'Physical AI' unit, joining rush to robotics by tech and automakers
articles.summary: Arm Holdings reorganized to form a Physical AI unit, merging automotive and robotics, aiming to boost growth in robotics with partners like Boston Dynamics and Tesla, as revealed at CES in Las Vegas.

articles.title: Beijing moves to curb reliance on US AI chips, halts Nvidia H200 purchases
articles.summary: China has asked select technology companies to temporarily stop purchasing Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence chips while policymakers assess future access to high-performance US semiconductors and encourage greater use of domestic alternatives.

articles.title: Samsung’s rolling Ballie robot indefinitely shelved after delays
articles.summary: Samsung Electronics Co. has sidelined Ballie, its long-awaited home robot, at CES despite past demos and a Google partnership, focusing instead on smart home tech and ambient AI innovations.

articles.title: X responds to MeitY over sexually explicit content generated by Grok
articles.summary: Platform cites user misuse, assures action against violations as government weighs next steps

articles.title: Researchers develop AI model that predicts disease risk from sleep data
articles.summary: More than 1,000 disease categories in the health records were looked at and 130 could be predicted with reasonable accuracy using a patient’s sleep data.

articles.title: Infosys, Cognition partner to deploy AI software agent Devin globally
articles.summary: Under the partnership, Infosys will deploy Devin across its internal engineering ecosystem and embed the AI agent within client delivery models worldwide. Shares of Infosys closed at ₹1,640, rising ₹27.80, or 1.72%, on January 7.

articles.title: Google AI messes up 2026, Elon Musk weighs in with quick verdict
articles.summary: A user asked Google search, “Is it 2027 next year?” The AI replied, “No, 2027 is not next year. 2026 is the next year, and 2027 will be the year after that, a common year starting on Friday, according to the Gregorian calendar.”

articles.title: CES 2026: Robots dance to K-pop, do laundry, and steal the show | Watch
articles.summary: The world's largest consumer tech event saw promising new launches from top electronics and robotics companies. Robots stole the show for dancing to the beats of K-pop songs to performing everyday mundane tasks with precision.

articles.title: Indian presence continues to grow at CES: top executive at world's biggest technology showcase
articles.summary: CES Vice President and Show Director John Kelley mentioned Bangalore-based technology and wearables company Ultrahuman, which he said they're "really excited to welcome to the show this year.” Ultrahuman’s products include the world’s lightest sleep-tracking wearable, a continuous glucose monitoring platform and a preventive blood testing platform.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s xAI closes $20 billion funding with Nvidia backing
articles.summary: Wall Street bankers will be able to recover their investment by using the vehicle to purchase Nvidia processors, which xAI will then rent out for five years.The distinctive deal structure, supported by the GPUs rather than the company, might provide a model for tech companies trying to reduce their debt exposure.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: Govt gives X time till January 7 to submit report

articles.title: SBI ATM charges revised: What changes for savings and salary account holders
articles.summary: State Bank of India revised ATM and ADWM charges at other banks’ ATMs from December 1, 2025, raising fees for savings and salary accounts after free transaction limits are exceeded.

articles.summary: Upstream firms face challenges from falling crude and gas prices. Lower crude prices benefit refining margins. Petroleum product consumption is projected to increase. City gas distribution companies anticipate sequential improvement in earnings spreads.

articles.summary: This expansion includes transmission, distribution, grid connectivity, and EPC services. The company is also growing its battery, inverter, transformer, and electrolyzer businesses.

articles.summary: Damilola Ogunbiyi of Sustainable Energy for All highlights this momentum. India is seen as a leader in this transition, sharing its expertise. Cooperation among developing nations is a key focus. India s work on energy efficiency is also crucial for these economies.

articles.summary: This ambitious project, with an investment of approximately ₹10,000 crore, aims to produce synthetic natural gas from high-ash Indian coal. The facility will be located at Talaipalli and is expected to consume substantial amounts of coal. Technology tie-ups are underway to finalize the project s processes.

articles.summary: State-owned explorer says rapid response after blowout during workover ranks among its fastest containment efforts.

articles.title: Gen-Z protests in 3 Asian nations must be examined: Manish Tewari
articles.summary: Congress MP Manish Tewari urged a thorough study of recent Gen-Z protests in South Asia, questioning if they were organic or manipulated. He highlighted the fall of governments in Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bangladesh, suggesting a need to differentiate genuine grievances from weaponized narratives. Tewari also expressed optimism about India's relationship with Bangladesh despite current tensions.

articles.title: Fed showdown: Donald Trump’s legal move against Jerome Powell sharpens rate-cut battle; raises questions over central bank independence
articles.summary: The US Justice Department's threat to indict Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell over building renovations has sparked a major clash with the White House. Powell claims this is a pretext to force interest rate cuts, asserting his commitment to independent monetary policy. This unprecedented challenge to the Fed's autonomy raises concerns for markets and the broader economy.

articles.title: The Great Pacific Garbage Patch is becoming home to some aquatic species
articles.summary: Scientists have discovered that plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean is now home to marine life. Coastal animals are unexpectedly surviving and even reproducing on floating debris. This new community, formed on plastic rafts, is altering ocean ecosystems. The findings reveal the high seas are not as empty as previously believed, being reshaped by human waste.

articles.title: Australia moves India into highest-risk category for student visas, cites 'emerging integrity risks'
Turning point? Canada's tumultuous relationship with China
articles.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will head to Beijing on Tuesday to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, hoping for closer ties as he looks to reduce his country's dependence on the United States. It will be Carney's first official trip to China as prime minister, and the first visit by a Canadian leader to Beijing since Justin Trudeau's in December 2017.

articles.title: Nepal's unemployed youth scramble for election jobs
articles.summary: Tens of thousands of young Nepalis have applied for temporary jobs policing upcoming elections, the first polls since a youth-led uprising spotlighted the Himalayan nation's economic woes. Many of the young applicants would be participating in their first election as a temporary police officers.

articles.title: “I don't have much time”: Candace Owens says Charlie Kirk appeared in her dreams with a disturbing warning about who betrayed him
articles.summary: Candace Owens shared a disturbing account of recurring dreams in which Charlie Kirk appeared urgently, claiming he had been betrayed. She said the message became clearer weeks later, revealing a specific name that compelled her to reach out privately. Owens emphasized the vividness of the experience and noted that her message went unanswered, deepening lingering questions.

articles.title: “Supposed to be a secret”: Creepy 140-year-long YouTube upload is unsettling the internet for one chilling reason
articles.summary: A mysterious YouTube channel has gone viral after uploading a silent black screen video that appears to run for 140 years. The impossible runtime has sparked confusion, glitch theories, and conspiracy talk online. With millions of views and no clear explanation, the upload has left viewers unsettled and questioning how such a video could exist on the platform.

articles.title: How old is Marlon the streamer as viral Indiyah Polack video sparks fresh questions about Dami Hope cheating rumors
articles.summary: Marlon Lundgren Garcia is 24 years old and went viral after a video showed him kissing Indiyah Polack in December 2025.
